104501.name: James Bond in Programmed for Danger
104501.description:
Publisher Blurb:

You are James Bond! The revolutionary Z-dis - a micro-energy source - has been stolen. Will you recover it before it falls into the wrong hands?

104502.name: James Bond in Barracuda Run
104502.description:
Publisher Blurb:

You are James Bond-forced to match wits with a mad genius and keep the world from being destroyed by a killer submarine. Can you win this battle?

104503.name: Morgan Swift and the Treasure of Crocodile Key
104503.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Scuba diving with Morgan Swift in key west leads to an amazing - and dangerous - adventure!

104504.name: Reversal of Fortune
104504.description:
The Pirate Captain followed a treasure map and found mounds of gold right where the X marked the spot. Now, the adventure is over and it is time to transport the booty back to the ship.

Take on the role of a greedy pirate, only interested in pocketing as much of the treasure for yourself, hoping this will be your Reversal of Fortune.

The rules are simple:
Shuffle the two decks thoroughly. Deal out five cards to each player from the Action Deck. For each turn, play or discard one card. End your turn by drawing a new card.

104505.name: Indiana Jones and the Ape Slaves of Howling Island
104505.description:
Publisher Blurb:

RABID DOBERMANS, GIANT APES, AND SINISTER SECRETS...

Off the coast of Eastern China, archaeologist Billie Simpson is leading a dig for Malaysian artifacts on Howling Island when her expedition is raided by a crazed scientist who threatens to kill them all. Barely escaping with her life, Billie now desperately wants to return to the island to find her brother.

A foul wind blows off Howling Island-and an eerie sound, too. Nobody knows where the bone-chilling noise is coming from. Yet there are much graver concerns: shocking double crosses, vicious attack dogs, a nation of brainwashed six-hundred-pound gorillas, and one dangerous, demonic man with wicked ideas for some very hideous experiments....

Race along with R. L. STINE-master of perilous thrills and icy chills-as he takes you and the intrepid Indiana Jones on the adventure of your life! But remember: Your fate is in your hands!

104506.name: Indiana Jones and the Mask of the Elephant
104506.description:
Publisher Blurb:

YOU and Indiana Jones cannot rest until you find THE MASK OF THE ELEPHANT

Legend has it, deep in the Congo one thousand years ago, an enormous elephant terrorized an African tribe. To ward off the creature's angry spirit, the tribesmen fashioned a glittering gold and diamond elephant mask. Soon after, the killer bull vanished. And so did the priceless mask.

But now Indiana Jones is cracking his whip in the Congo. And fortunately for you: first he interrupts your visit with some imposing dinner hosts and then the hair-raiding search begins, with you and Indy meeting the likes of 12-foot crocs, hostile natives with poison darts, and the insidious rival archaeologist C.P. Smythe. Along the way YOU make the decisions that will lead you and Indy to the precious elephant mask and the return of a legend-as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104507.name: Operation: Star Raider
104507.description:
From the Back of the Book:

The G.I. Joe Team must protect a top-level nuclear scientist in OPERATION: STAR RAIDER.

Your code name is Wiseguy, because you are able to think fast and make snap decisions under pressure. Snake Eyes, Spirit, Blowtorch and Ripcord are among the Joes in your outfit.

Your assignment: to keep Dr. Newton FitzSimmons safe while he visits the U.S. Defence Department with the plans for his new nuclear anti-missile device, called the Star Raider. You are to meet the great scientist at a New York airport and transport him safely to Washington D.C. You must make sure no one can get to him - especially Cobra!

Will you live up to your nickname? You begin to wonder when you see a Cobra helicopter circling in the sky. And that's only the beginning. Hungry wolves, the Cobra crimson guards, and even a very unusual dog will test your shrewdness, Wiseguy. Do your best to make the right strategic decision as you FIND YOUR FATE...


User Summary:

Eric Affabee is a pseudonym used by R. L. Stine

104508.name: Operation: Dragon Fire
104508.description:
From the Back of the Book:

The GI Joe Team must thwart Cobra's deadly plans in OPERATION: DRAGON FIRE.

You are watching a satellite display of the Western USA in the GI Joe team's command center when before your eyes a huge area of South Dakota explodes!

Quickly, your commanding officer: Hawk, assembles a team which includes Lady Jaye, Rock'N'Roll, Roadblock, and you, codenamed Spider - an electronics expert. Hawk informs you that Cobra is responsible for the blast. Now your team must uncover the rest of Cobra's deadly plan - and neutralize it.

Rushing to South Dakota, you are suddenly trapped underground by another blast! Tanks and machine guns are everywhere! A Cobra weapons supplier: Destro, seems to be your ally - but how can you be sure? You are caught, Spider, in a shattering web of intrigue and deceit. You have to make split-second decisions that are a matter of life and death - for you and the entire free world - as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104509.name: Operation: Terror Trap
104509.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Only the GI Joe Team can stop a madman in OPERATION: TERROR TRAP.

You are in the Pit, the secret underground headquarters of the GI Joe Team. Hawk, your leader, tells you that a despot who calls himself The One has defeated the armed forces of an East African nation and taken over the country! The Joe Team believes The One - who is rumored to have a secret hideout in New York City - is backed by Cobra!

Your code name is Dog Ear because of your experience in battling street toughs. Now you will join Lady Jaye, Duke, Gung Ho, Dusty, and Quick Kick on a plane bound for Africa. Your mission: Infiltrate the government and put an end to The One's reign.

The violent storm that engulfs your plan is only the beginning. This is an incredibly dangerous mission! You must make split-second decisions at every turn. Do your best to succeed, Dog Ear, as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104510.name: Operation: Robot Assassin
104510.description:
From the Back of the Book:

The GI Joe Team is the last hope for preventing world chaos in OPERATION: ROBOT ASSASSIN.

Military intelligence has learned that Cobra plans to assassinate all the world leaders and diplomats gathering for summit talks in Switzerland. Their weapon: an amazing, computer-controlled robot, so lifelike it can be disguised as one of the leaders, staff, or security guards.

Your skill in defusing bombs as well as other explosive situations has earned you the code name Hotshot. Now you must choose which team to join - Wild Bill, Duke, Bazooka, and others who will attempt to infiltrate Cobra, or Snow Job, Quick Kick, Fling and their cohorts, who will visit hotels and villas to see what they can learn.

In your quest to locate and diffuse the robot before it unleashes its devastating power, there are many choices to make - and each decision is up to you! The whole world will discover how skilled you really are, Hotshot as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104511.name: The Everglades Swamp Terror
104511.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Cobra has gone too far this time. The GI Joe Team can't let them get away with THE EVERGLADES SWAMP TERROR.

Duke calls an emergency meeting in the Briefing Room of the Pit: Cobra has kidnapped two members of the GI Joe Team!!

Torpedo and Trip-Wire were on a secret mission in the Florida Everglades, testing a new kind of hovercraft developed by the army. The GI Joe communications expert, Breaker, intercepted a Cobra message and learned your comrades had been taken prisoner.

Your team: Cutter, Lady Jaye, Gung-Ho, Deep Six, an Recondo. Your Mission: rescue Torpedo and Trip-Wire and retrieve the one-of-a-kind hovercraft. Your codename: Wiseguy. As strategy specialist, you will make the big decisions.

Cobra fighter planes, alligator pits, and armed fishermen are only a few of the dangers awaiting you. The very honor of the GI Joe Team is at stake, Wiseguy, so make the right moves as you FIND YOUR FATE.


User Summary:

Eric Affabee is pseudonym used by R. L. Stine.

104512.name: Operation: Death Stone
104512.description:
From the Back of the Book:

The GI Joe Team may be the only hope for averting enemy attack in OPERATION: DEATH STONE.

In the torpedo room of an American submarine speeding toward a secret destination, Duke tells the assembled GI Joe Team members the details of your astonishing mission.

A strange meteor has landed on a remote Pacific jungle island. The meteor could be composed of an element so rare and powerful that it could help create a virtually indestructible alloy. Whoever gains possession of this element will be completely safe from attack - and can therefore destroy his enemies without fear of retribution.

Naturally, Cobra wants to possess the element as much as you do. Your job is to make sure it doesn't fall into their evil hands.

Your codename is Outlaw, because you've been known to bend the rules from time to time. Along with Roadblock, Snake-eyes, Recondo, Blowtorch, Gung-ho, and Mutt you will have to make critical decisions at every turn. Primitive headshrinking natives, blasting volcanoes, creepy caves, and a slew of Cobras await you as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104513.name: Operation: Deadly Decoy
104513.description:
From the Back of the Book:

The U.S. State Department is counting on the GI Joe Team to keep Cobra far away from Washington in OPERATION: DEADLY DECOY.

Your code name is Presto because of your amazing ability to look and sound like anyone you choose. This talent will be very important as you join Flint, Roadblock, Gung-Ho, and Lady Jaye in a breathtaking mission to make absolutely sure Cobra won't interfere in the secret talks between the U.S. President and China's Premier.

In the Briefing Room of the Pit, Duke outlines your two-part plan. Operation New Pit will attempt to lure Cobra to what appears to be the GI Joe Team's new headquarters in Northern California's Sierra Mountains. Even more clever is Operation Circus, in which you, Presto, will pose as the President's young son, attending an international circus in Berlin. Cobra will probably try to kidnap you - and get a big surprise.

These missions require split-second thinking. At every turn you'll face plenty of danger, so make the right decisions as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104514.name: Operation: Death-Ray
104514.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Cobra has gained control of a very powerful weapon. Only the GI Joe Team can stop them from using it in OPERATION: DEATH-RAY.

If the U.S. government doesn't give Cobra all its gold, Cobra says it will blow up a major U.S. city. That's no empty threat - Cobra possesses a bomb, developed by a Russian scientist, that circles the earth on a telecommunications satellite and can be detonated at any time.

Your team consists of Flint, Torpedo, Deep-Six, Tripwire, and you, Break-In. Your specialties are dismantling security systems, gaining access to heavily guarded areas, and scuba diving! You'll need all these talents in this daring mission, which races from Hawaii to Finland to a Siberian prison.

Be smart, be brave, be careful! The lives of millions of people are in your hands, so do your very best as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104515.name: Operation: Mindbender
104515.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Cobra is attempting to infiltrate and destroy the GI Joe Team. Only YOU can stop them in OPERATION: MINDBENDER.

Army spy planes have picked up evidence of covert military operations on a small island in the South Pacific. Your team - Leatherneck, Airtight, Beach Head, and you, Commando - have been sent to investigate.

But suddenly Beach Head and Airtight attack you and Leatherneck! It's unbelievable, but you find yourself in a vicious fight with your own team members!

When it's over, you notice that Beach Head and Airtight are disoriented and confused. They see you as the enemy. They have been brainwashed!

You have to save your friends from Cobra's clutches - and make sure this brainwashing doesn't happen again. Vital decisions are up to you as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104516.name: Operation: Night Flight
104516.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Is Cobra behind the theft of an important new defensive weapon? The GI Joe Team must uncover the truth about OPERATION: NIGHT FLIGHT.

Your code name is Delta. You're a pilot training for advanced ratings in nighttime fixed-wing combat in the new P-140 fighter plane.

While on guard duty, you observe three members of the GI Joe Team coming toward you. Suddenly, they open fire - and moments later take off in the P-140! Would real members of the Team steal the plane??

Of course, you all suspect that Cobra is behind the caper. You and your team - Low-Light, Gung-Ho, Rock 'n Roll, and Dial Tone - must find the plane and make sure no infiltrators remain on the base.

This is a tricky case, Delta! A wrong move can have serious consequences, so make the right choices as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104517.name: Operation: Weapons Disaster
104517.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Cobra has grown very ambitious. Only the GI Joe Team can match their fierce new firepower in OPERATION: WEAPONS DISASTER.

Anything that moves, YOU can make it go faster. Wheels, that's your codename - enemy vehicle and weapons expert.

When Cobra starts throwing new weapons and vehicles at GI Joe Teams all over the world, Duke sends for you. Flint and Lady Jaye are under fire from Cobra gun cycles in Africa; Bazooka and Roadblock are bushwhacked by Cobra combat tanks in New Mexico; and Iceberg and Sci-Fi are pinned down by Cobra snowsleds in the Alps. But you can't be everywhere at once. What is Cobra up to?

You must weigh your choices carefully - but quickly. And be prepared to face Cobra's most ingenious machinery. In any event, this looks like a good time to field test your new combat motorcycle. Peel out, Wheels, you have no time to lose as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104518.name: Operation: Jungle Doom
104518.description:
From the Back of the Book:

The GI Joe Team must win a deadly biological game in OPERATION: JUNGLE DOOM.

In the underground Briefing Room of the Pit, Hark gives you and a grim GI Joe team the news: Cobra has joined forces with the mad genius Dr. Daimon to spread a toxin so lethal it can destroy all the plants in the Amazon in just six weeks.

The meaning is clear: Without all that oxygen, every being on earth will smother!

All eyes are on you, Lightning - you're the expert at split-second tactical decisions. Which assault team should you choose: Airtight, Roadblock, Alpine, and Iceberg, to hit Daimon's fortress in the sheer Andes? Or Lady Jaye, Low-Light, Beach Head, and Wet Suit, to penetrate the Amazon and knock out the toxin fogging device? And what if you're too late??

Crack Cobra Snow Serpents and savage Cobra-trained Indians await you. You must strike fast, Lightning, as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104519.name: Lemming Renascence
104519.description:
"Lemmings Renascence" is a fun game for the company from 2 to 5 players. Each player is responsible for the resettlement of one swarm of lemmings (with the game on two players - two). Phases of the game are divided into several stages: a common event, reproduction(placing lemming on the territory of your choice),playing and drawing instinct cards(which are usually affect all lemmings on a single territory), the definition of the strongest swarm. The key game mechanics are the avalanche of migration of lemmings that players often can not control (when number of lemmings reach critical max for a territory, they're starting to run all directions randomly). Well, usually, lemmings fall off a cliff, but not all die ...some fly away :)

There are 3 ways to win the game:
1. When instinct deck ends, player who has the biggest and widest swarm wins.
2. When all of your lemmings situated on the game board you win instantly
3. When you have 7 flying lemmings you win instantly.

^_^

104520.name: Operation: Snow Job
104520.description:
From the Back of the Book:

What a diabolical plan! Cobra will drown us all if the GI Joe Team can't stop them in OPERATION: SNOW JOB.

"There's only one person who can find Cobra's snow fortress," says GI Joe commander Hawk in his steely voice as he turns and points to you.

You are Compass, expert in reconnaissance and small arms, extraordinary at scouting without landmarks. No wonder Hawk and the Team rely on you - you're the only one who can navigate in murderous temperatures, near-zero visibility and treacherous terrain. While under fire, of course.

The world is being held hostage. Cobra has teamed up with the maniacal Destro and fiendish Dr. Mindbender, and they're planning to raise water levels by melting the polar ice caps. Millions will drown! You've got 72 hours to lead Hawk, Roadblock, Low-Light, Lifeline, Dial-Tone, and Iceberg through a dangerous frozen maze of crack Cobra Viper Squads, polar bears, and more to stop Cobra's evil plot.

The bleak frozen tundra looks the same everywhere. Which direction will you take, Compass? The planet is counting on you as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104521.name: Age of Sovereigns
104521.description:
At its core, "The Age of Sovereigns" is a military strategy, but the game is not limited strictly to combating. An important part of gameplay is the construction of buildings (common and special buildings, 26 total). Due to these constructions players can multiply their wealth and / or fame, along with the development of the army.

The game is divided into various stages. In the era of "Kingdoms Rising" players gradually get bonuses specific to the kingdom. In the era of the "End of Times" all events are resolved. These two steps constitute the main part of the game, when the players give a variety of orders and fight. In the era of "Destiny" victory points and fines are scored.

The dice are not used during the battles, so the game is not that much random ;)

The game has low downtime and relatively short playing time (30 minutes per player).

104522.name: EGATrek
104522.description:
From the Back of the Box

"EGATrek is based on the classic minicomputer space game but updates it with colorful EGA graphics. Your computer screen becomes the control of a starship captain, complete with scanners, maps, communications, fire control, and even an outside view of the ship. The object is to defeat all enemy ships in your assigned portion of the galaxy. The game includes several levels of difficulty, multiple saved games, and a detailed report of your success (or failure) at the end of each mission."

104523.name: Fluxation
104523.description:
Fluxation is a two player game where each player tries to get the highest score from 0 to 15. Their scores are modified by a flux diagram built with tiles which contains simple lines of computer code.

A player can put tiles, run the diagram, eliminate 'bugs' or discard his or her hand in each turn.

No complex knowledge is needed to play Fluxation; just add, substract and compare numbers to win your opponent.

Scores are limited to 4 bits! It means that no number is higher than 15 or lower than 0. So 15+1 = 0! and 0-1=15! Be careful!

104524.name: Shooting Gallery
104524.description:
From the Back of the Box

Shooting Gallery recreates a shooting range on a computer screen and includes action packed rounds. Round 1 is a version of the carnival shooting booth. Round 2 requires hitting a "clay pigeon", a target that is tossed off into the distance that you try to hit with a shotgun (a.k.a skeet shooting). In Round 3 you must quick draw against a target and Round 4 is a repeat of Round 1 except point values have increased and the targets change direction. Round 5 requires hitting two clay pigeons with your double-barreled shotgun. In Round 6 you must quick draw against two targets. And finally, in Round 7, you are suddenly transported back into the wild west where you must finish off all the bad guys without accidentally shooting the townspeople.

104525.name: Escape from the Dead City
104525.description:
Escape from the Dead City is a card game of survival horror, where each player must control a group of survivors trapped in a putrid zombie infested city. Players will have to stock up and prepare as best they can before they escape from this hell full of undead.

During the game, the survivors will visit the city in search of other people, weapons, food, water, vehicles and anything that might be useful. Despite being a competitive game, players can cooperate if they are in the same place, but only one can win. The first player to get Survival Points needed may flee the city, thus winning the game.

But it will not be easy to escape, because danger lurks around every corner, and zombies are not the only ones who can end the life of the group.

videogame.71187: Might and Magic I: The Secret of the Inner Sanctum

104526.name: Might and Magic 6-Pack

videogamecompilation.71187: Might and Magic I: The Secret of the Inner Sanctum

104526.description:
User Summary

A collection of the first six Might and Magic games, as well as Swords of Xeen, originally from the Might and Magic Trilogy compilation.

104527.name: The Game of Life Adventure Edition
104527.description:
The Game of Life, the classic board game you no doubt played as a child, is to get a make over for 2011 Hasbro has confirmed to Pocket-lint.

The new version of the board game will now be called Game of Life: Adventures Edition and focus on multiple career paths based on islands that you can travel between.

Updated for the modern world, the latest version of the classic board game is literally a 'spin' on the original..

The new design features a rotating game board that can shift the direction of the game with one twist of a spinner – changing certain sections of the board to baffle and challenge other players!

There are also refreshed graphics, new jobs and the introduction of planes, islands and family pets, but the game's challenges remain the same: steer clear of trouble and make the right choices on the journey through life.

104528.name: Inca
104528.description:
"Inca has been famous for combining many different genres including space simulator and adventure game to form a certain storyline. Although mostly a fighting space simulator, some levels were purely shooting, had maze exploration, and some included riddles that could be solved by combining inventory items."

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inca_%28video_game%29,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

104529.name: SpaceChem: 63 Corvi
104529.description:
User Summary

63 Corvi is downloadable content for the 'insanely addictive' SpaceChem. In this expansion, conquer 63 Corvi's quirky quantum mechanics where the input reactor molecules cannot cross to the output reactor side without traveling through the quantum tunnel. These puzzles take the quantum tunnel to a new level.

This was originally available as a prize in the Steam 2011 Summer Camp giveaway for three golden tickets.

videogame.72769: Heroes of Might and Magic IV

104530.name: Heroes of Might and Magic IV Complete

videogamecompilation.72769: Heroes of Might and Magic IV

104530.description:
User Summary

The compilation of all three releases for Heroes of Might and Magic IV.

104531.name: Eternium
104531.description:
Eternium is a mythical card game where you can trade and battle. The aim is to 'dominate' - create the ultimate collection of cards that will let you win every time.

You create the dominating card collection by trading and battling. In a battle, both players may 'risk' a 4 or 5 star card and whoever wins keeps both.

There are three types of Cards: Monster, Combat and Special. You must always play a Monster Card - both Special and Combat cards can be used in addition to the Monster on each turn.

The game is popular with younger children because there is a vivid story and the monsters are found to be very imaginative and in some cases comparable to people they know in real life.

104533.name: Operation: Thunderbolt
104533.description:
From the Front of the Book:

You are a member of the GI Joe team! If you don't thwart Cobra's takeover of the earth's satellites, the planet will face destruction from space! Live the adventure!

104534.name: Operation: Time Machine
104534.description:
From the Front of the Book:

You are a member of the GI Joe Team! Stop Cobra's time machine from wiping out history, or the human race will be doomed! Live The Adventure!

104535.name: The Secrets of Atlantis: The Secret Legacy
104535.description:
The Secrets of Atlantis: The Sacred Legacy is a fantasy adventure computer game developed by The Adventure Company and published by Dreamcatcher Interactive, and released in 2007. It's the fifth and latest game in the Atlantis series started by Cryo, and the second one made by The Adventure Company.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Secrets_of_Atlantis:_The_Sacred_Legacy," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

104536.name: Operation: Poison Dart
104536.description:
From the Back of the Book:

A globe of mindless COBRA slaves? Only the GI Joe Team can thwart such a threat in OPERATION: POISON DART.

Your code name: Headset. Your specialty: unusual. As deprogrammer and hypnotist, you free the minds of brainwashed victims - or smooth-talk your way past COBRA guards.

Now you face your toughest mission. Dr. Mindbender has brainwashed a top-notch scientist into developing a mind control drug for COBRA. An important U.S. general is under the spell. Will the general turn U.S. weapons against the world, or will COBRA dominate the wills of billions of people?

Roadblock, Flint, Dial-Tone, Dusty, Mutt, Mainframe, Lady Jaye, and Leatherneck are all there to help you. But it's up to you, Headset, and your powers of persuasion. Can you outdo your arch-counterpart Dr. Mindbender? It's a test of wills with the world as the prize, as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104537.description:
A one page rules supplement and a pack of 9 translucent blue Martian Scouts that can be added to any existing Invasion From Outer Space scenario. The Scouts are deployed via a new Command Console Button (Cost=1) and are removed from the game when killed. Once deployed, Scouts behave as normal martians but with the following special abilities:

Scouts may move 2 spaces per turn.
The Scout's Ray Gun always hits on 3+.
Scouts ignore any wound on a roll of 4+ (except those from fire or explosives).
Scouts do not count as a Martian Pack when rolling for reinforcements.

The back side of the rules supplement contains a new scenario "The Beacon" in which the Martian player attempts to secure three buildings and install homing devices in them. If they succeed, the beacon is triggered and a full scale invasion of earth commences.
104537.name: Invasion From Outer Space: Cloaked Martian Scouts

42939.name: Invasion from Outer Space: The Martian Game

boardgamefamily.9043: Last Night on Earth Game Engine

104538.name: Operation: Sink or Swim
104538.description:
From the Back of the Book:

The G.I. Joe Team has seconds left to defuse COBRA's plans for disaster in OPERATION: SINK OR SWIM.

Finally, a little rest and relaxation for you, Low-Light, Roadblock, and Mainframe. It's a perfect day for you and the guys to see the big city from the top of the Empire State Building.

But you never make it. When the beautiful woman you bump into turns out to be COBRA female menace Zarana, you know your vacation is over. Now New York City's eight million inhabitants are going to need you - Brainstorm, lightning quick strategist - to outguess Zarana and her psycho brother Zandar's fiendish plot to demolish the financial and communications capital of the world.

From the dark subway tunnels filled with COBRA assassins, to the nighttime raid on a COBRA tanker, this mission gives you no time to rest. You must act swiftly, Brainstorm, to keep New York on the map as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104539.name: Operation: Killer Comet
104539.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Never before has the G.I. Joe Team faced such an awesome force as in OPERATION: KILLER COMET.

What is it, Cat? What is it that's fishy about G.I. Joe Team leader Hawk?

Only you would know. As the newest member of the Team, you have uncanny instincts and agility - that's why your codename is Cat. For you, this adventure begins on the set of the latest G.I. Joe movie. COBRA has hatched a plot to rule the world...by threatening to create a collision course with a comet!

Lifeline, Dial-Tone, Alpine, Gung-Ho, Duke, Roadblock, Bazooka, Dusty, and Lift-Ticket - you've got great personnel behind you. But it's up to your instincts to catwalk your team through a web of COBRA Ferrets, mirage-filled deserts, and the savage assassin Storm Shadow. Your goal is the heart of the COBRA command center and the dreaded Terror Drome...from which no ally has returned. Be careful, or you'll run out of lives as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104540.name: Operation: Tiger Strike
104540.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Only the G.I. Joe Team is brave enough to volunteer for OPERATION: TIGER STRIKE.

"So that's the story, Sting," says a grim-faced Hawk. Your eyes meet the gaze of Roadblock, Gung-Ho, Dial-Tone, and Recondo.

Hawk wants you - Sting, one of the G.I. Joe Team's top martial artists - to join him and the other men on an unauthorized mission to save Lily Soong, an old friend's kidnapped daughter. Alone in the Orient and without operation support, this mission will require stealth, speed, and savage hand-to-hand combat. How can you refuse?

But you might find obstacles you did not reckon for - hordes of evil Ninjas, your fighting equal Storm Shadow, COBRA arms dealer Destro, and an ingenious Temple of Death filled with cruel booby traps. One wrong move and you might not come back! So sharpen your senses, Sting, as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104541.name: Serpentor and the Mummy Warrior
104541.description:
From the Back of the Book:

It's the G.I. Joe Team versus a genetically perfect warrior in SERPENTOR AND THE MUMMY WARRIOR.

How did you, Bombshell, the meanest, nastiest, most fearless G.I. Joe ever, end up in Egypt fighting a mummy? Why complain? At least it's combat!

Your enemies are formidable: COBRA scientist Dr. Mindbender. Hordes of Hun warriors. And Serpentor, Mindbender's finest creation - a genetic mix of the ten best warriors of all time. But don't forget that you came to rescue the kidnapped Dr. Wilmott and the mummy he was carbon-dating. If you don't bring them back, Mindbender and Serpentor will reanimate the mummy, unleashing its ancient powers, and civilization will face endless war.

When you explode into action, Bombshell, make sure you pick the right time and place as you FIND YOUR FATE.

104542.name: World War II: Sniper – Call to Victory
104542.description:
User Summary

Taking the role of an Airborne soldier in 1944, the player must do through 10 missions, from Market Garden to the Battle of the Bulge.

The game uses the LithTech Jupiter engine.

104543.name: Jewels in the Dark
104543.description:
From the Back of the Book:

You are Jem, the super-glamorous rock star! You're in New York City for a whirlwind of parties and concerts to promote a new line of costume jewelry based on the priceless Langley jewels. - But while you're modeling the real Langley jewels at a big photo shoot, the room suddenly gets dark. When the lights come back on, the jewels are gone! - Your rivals, the Misfits, and the ruthless Eric Raymond - who'll do anything to hurt your reputation - blame the crime on you! Now you and the Holograms must find the real thieves!

104544.name: 3D Hot Shot
104544.description:
User Summary

A simulation of the popular arcade machine where you throw a rubber basketball through a moving hoop before time runs out. The game features full 3D effects, advanced physics simulation, a unique multiple hoops feature, and ever more challenging levels.

104545.name: Tesseract
104545.description:
User Summary

In this puzzle game, you manipulate a four-dimensional Tesseract, also known as a Hypercube, through a series of progressively harder levels. You swipe the cube to rotate one of its 3D cubes; you pinch and unpinch to rotate the Tesseract through the fourth dimension.

This game is designed to be very difficult!

104546.name: Tap Tap Remove
104546.description:
Nemo Games is happy to announce a wonderful matching game for all mobile gamers!

We have 3 wonderful musics for you to choose from while playing the game. Use OpenFeint leaderboards to brag about your highscores! We have 3 levels of difficulty for you to play.

Features

Fun & Simple game-play
3 Levels of difficulty
Cool board and tile particles
Happy sets of colors
Retina Display for iPhone 4
Board size for iPad & iPhone
Bonus for removing bigger blocks of tiles
OpenFeint (online leaderboards)




How to Play
Tap to remove blocks of two or more tiles of the same color.

Source: The Game Website.

104547.description:
Kickstarter description:

"Imperial Crusade Armada is a tactical space combat card game that uses plastic cards made of the same material as credit cards to represent each ship on the tabletop. These cards have ship stats printed on them so that everything that happens during a battle can be tracked directly on the card with a dry erase pen. Battles between a few ships can be played in a couple of minutes or massive fleet battles can be played in about an hour."
104547.name: Imperial Crusade Armada

104549.name: PokerCross
104549.description:
From Developer website

The solitaire combination of Poker and your favorite word games.

Introductory price of $0.99!
In PokerCross you try to score big points by playing cards on the board to form the best Poker hands you can. Play off the cards already on the board and try to save cards to get the big bonus for rare hands.

There are eight Jokers in the deck to help keep your game going and a variety of Leaderboards and Achievements to keep you coming back for more.

104550.name: Total It!

468.name: The United States Playing Card Company

104550.description:
From the box: Addition & subtraction have never been so much fun (or fast)! Players have to match the number of the card in play by using + or -! Collect the most points or discard all your cards first and you win!

Gameplay: Each player gets 7 cards. The remaining cards become the draw pile. The dealer turns over the top card of the draw pile. Each player tries to match the number on the card with either an exact match, or using two cards with + or -. Multiple matches can be played. Players keep matched cards in front of them to track points. The dealer then brings all players back up to 7 cards. Then a new target card is drawn. When there are not enough cards left to bring everyone to 7 cards, the game is over.
An alternate rule set eliminates the target card and plays 11 rounds using the numbers 1 to 10 and a wild round where each player names their own target number.

104551.name: In Flames
104551.description:
Publisher Blurb:

What you know...
You are not in your own body. You can remember snatches of your past, of a heavenly existence, and of a terrible fall from grace, but no more. This place is only fleetingly familiar.

What you have been told...
The thing that calls itself Ghede has told you that you were once something more than human; you were a god, a post-human, one of the Loa.

You and your fellows carved worlds from pure matter, danced in the corona with suns and created life as playthings. You moulded the very stars themselves, and held worlds in the palm of your hand. Your world was called the Understar - a paradise beyond this reality. Separated from the material realm, your kind found delight in watching and manipulating the lesser beings trapped in a material existence on the Flame Worlds, playthings created for your pleasure. You called it Dreaming, an endless source of entertainment and intrigue.

But times change. You committed a crime.

A terrible crime, one that stood against all that your peers believed in. And for that you were thrown out, ejected, cast down to the lower worlds, named an Exile. Now the Understar seems little more than a vague memory that slips through your fingers.

But there is hope. Ghede, the force that represents the Understar in the material reality, has offered you a chance to return home. All you must do is walk these lesser worlds performing tasks as required by your new master, and in doing so find a way to resolve the guilt of your crime. What you seek is forgiveness and a return to the Understar. Under Ghede's guidance you invoke your one-time comrades, the Loa, and through them reveal more of your home and your past. Doing so risks psychosis, but Ghede gives you the black pills it keeps to help with that, as long as you are good.

This is where you are - the Flame Worlds, a hazily remembered place of death and intrigue, among billions of souls trapped in this mundane existence. You and your fellow Exiles must accept Ghede's offer, and meet others of your kind to do his bidding. What will you discover among the Flame Worlds? Who knows, but if it ends your exile, it is worth it.

In Flames is a science fiction role-playing game of action, adventure, psychosis and discovery utilising a variant of the D6 system.

104552.name: Rugby 08
104552.description:
Rugby 08 is the 2007 release in the Rugby series by EA Sports. The game allows players to play as many Rugby nations, both major and minor, and includes many tournaments, such as the Rugby World Cup, Tri Nations, Six Nations, Guinness Premiership and Super 14.
Rugby 08 was released prior to the 2007 World Cup in France. New modes include the Rugby World Cup and the World Cup Challenge mode. Other new gameplay features include simplified lineouts and defensive formations.
The commentary is provided by Ian Robertson a former All Blacks great Grant Fox.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rugby_08,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

104553.description:
Moeraki - Kemu is about the rivalry between two Maori tribes on the southern island of New Zealand: the Matau (hooks) and the Manala (birds).

The game is played on a diagonal grid, with the players playing pieces on the intersections. The basic game is played as follows:

At the start of the game, the first player places the neutral Moeraki-ball on one of the nine central intersections of the board. After that, the players take turns placing one of their own pieces on the board. When a square is on the board is completely enclosed by pieces, the player who has the majority (normally 3:1, but it can be 2:1 or 3:0 next to the edge or the neutral Moeraki-ball) claims the field and places a tribe marker on it.

The game can be won in one of four ways:
1. Tahuna (beach): A player wins if he has enclosed a field with four of his own pieces.
2. Awa (river): A player wins if he has a piece on each of the intersections on one of the diagonal lines from one edge to another edge.
3. Ara (road): A player wins if he has a piece on each of the four intersections on one edge.
4. Marae (holy ground): When all the fields in the center have been claimed, players count the number of tribal markers they have got on the board (markers that are on the edge and that have been claimed with a 2:1 majority count only half). The player with the most markers wins the game.

The players win several matches, until one of them has won the pre-determined amount of matches.

In the advanced version of the game, both players receive a Maori-Tane (warrior). Once during the game, a player may place the Tane on the board instead of a tribal marker. When he does so, all he chooses a direction. Any fields between the Tane and the edge in that direction cannot be claimed; any markers already present are removed.
104553.name: Moeraki: Kemu

104554.name: Sweet16: Matchmaker
104554.description:
Sweet16 is a lightly themed memory game inspired by Calcory from Mu & more by Doris Matthaus and Frank Nestel. It can be used as an educational tool to develop counting and memory skills in young children and with the full set of rules is a challenging and fun game for more serious gamers.

The game uses a standard deck of cards and melds hidden information, memory, bluffing and special card powers into a fun, short game.

Cards are revealed with the aim of having their values sum to 16. Players can push their luck or engage their memory and hope to avoid going bust. Or they can play it safe and hope their opponent cannot outdo their achievement. If a player succeeds they collect the revealed cards into a score pile. One of the cards is re-hidden and another can be used for it's special power. Highest score wins.

The theme is nominally about high-school intrigue and dating.

104555.description:
A valuable diamond – the Blue Lion – is on display at the Louvre and two thieves, Arsène Lupin Lupin and Lady X, both want to steal it.

The Blue Lion is played using six tiles. Each tile shows an icon on both the front and back: Lupin, Lady X, the Blue Lion diamond, or a police inspector. Each combination of two icons occurs once. One player plays as Lupin, the other as Lady X. During set-up, these tiles are arranged in a row. In turn, the players take one tile and add it to the front or the back of the line, without looking at the back of the tile. After this set-up, the players try to score points by creating special combinations of tiles. Each turn, a player can perform one of three actions to change the line:


Switch two adjacent tiles.
Move a tile that is on one end of the line to the other end of the line.
Flip a tile.


If this action results in a scoring combination of three tiles, the player scores points. The combinations are:


Sandwiching a tile showing the opponent by two tiles showing police inspectors: 1 point.
Sandwiching a tile showing the Blue Lion by two tiles showing the player's character: 2 points.
Creating a row of three tiles showing the Blue Lion: 3 points.


After a combination has been formed, the middle tile of the combination is removed. The opposing player then adds it to one end of the line, although he cannot score points by doing so.

The first player to score seven points wins.
104555.name: The Blue Lion

104556.name: Four Seasons Chess
104556.description: An interesting four-player version of chess from mediaeval Spain. Each player represents one of the seasons, and starts the game with a king, a rook, a knight, a bishop and four pawns in one corner of the board. The pawns are split, and move away from the corner in one of two directions. Each player is supposed to attack the player to his right, and on chackmating his opponent takes over the use of his pieces. From Alfonso X's Book of Games.

boardgamehonor.20121: 2012 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee

104557.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The world is big and your kingdom small. Small when compared to the world, that is; it's moderate-sized when compared to other kingdoms. But in a big world like this one - big when compared to smaller worlds anyway, if such things exist; it's moderate-sized when compared to worlds of roughly the same size, and a little small when compared to worlds just a little larger - well, to make a long story short - short when compared to longer stories anyway - it is time to stretch your borders. You've heard of far-off places - exotic countries, where they have pancakes but not waffles, where the people wear the wrong number of shirts, and don't even have a word for the look two people give each other when they each hope that the other will do something that they both want done but which neither of them wants to do. It is to these lands that you now turn your gaze.

Dominion: Hinterlands is the sixth addition to the game of Dominion. It adds 26 new Kingdom cards to Dominion, including 20 Actions, 3 Treasures, 3 Victory cards, and 3 Reactions. The central theme is cards that do something immediately when you buy them or gain them.

Part of the Dominion series.
104557.name: Dominion: Hinterlands

104558.description:
Burdigala is the Roman name for the city of Bordeaux. The game is about the growth of the city during the Roman times.

The board shows a map of the city, with various building sites and streets. At the beginning of the game, a tile is placed on each building site. Each tile shows a building and the reward for completing that building. On the back, it shows the amount of cubes needed to complete the building (2-5). The tiles are placed facedown, so that it is unknown which building is where.

Each turn, a player rolls two dice, picks one and moves his architect as many spaces along the streets as the die shows. Then, he adds a cube to a building site adjacent to his architect's current location. For this, he will receive a reward:
- If the building is not yet completed, he scores one point for each cube that is still needed to complete it.
- If the building is completed, the tile is flipped, and the player gains the reward shown on the tile.
In addition, if the building is completed, any other nearby architects will receive an Intrigue card that will give them some benefit.

Certain combinations on the dice (rolling seven or rolling doubles) allow the player to take a Corruption token (worth -5 to 0 points) to gain a specific benefit, such as a reroll or a double building action.

When there is no more building to be done, the player with the most points wins the game.

Languages : English, French, German, Italian, Spanish.
104558.name: Burdigala

104560.name: Putting the Band Back Together
104560.description:
Publisher Blurb

I bet you never knew that life was a game,
And a music-man’s life never brought him much fame.
Giving up gigging, he thought he’d said never,
But they’re PUTTING THE BAND BACK TOGETHER.

A tabletop game with pencils and dice,
A handful of mates (some snacks would be nice),
Some paper, these rules and somewhere to gather
To play PUTTING THE BAND BACK TOGETHER.

(guit solo)

Ben Wright wrote the rules, so you know they’re tight,
He knows how to role-play all through the night.
It’s funny and crazy and light as a feather-
It’s PUTTING THE BAND BACK TOGETHER.

104561.name: The Atomic Beast
104561.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The year is 1954, and the time of the Atom is upon us. Since the H-bombs were dropped during WWII the world has been a different place. Fear of both the Red Menace and the devastating power of the A-bomb runs deep in the hearts of the everyday American citizen. The government is working to ensure the safety and security of the country. Selfless men and women toil in the southwestern United States to develop weapons to keep the Commies at bay. The progress is slow, and some fear that we may be losing ground, but that just makes the dedicated scientists work even harder, and take even greater risks

A great adventure by master Keeper Bob Geis, in honor of the 30th Anniversary edition of Call of Cthulhu.

104562.name: Gamemastering
104562.description:
Subtitle: The Essential Guide for Roleplaying Gamemasters

Publisher Blurb: Over 300 pages of comprehensive techniques for Gamemasters of face-to-face roleplaying games.

Packed with dozens of useful tables, adventure ideas, tips, tricks and goodies.

Works with all game systems.

104564.name: L'ira di Anubi
104564.description:
User Summary

It's a textual adventure (some graphic embellish it, but is purely decorative and has no role in the game).
You give commands usually composed by a verb plus a noun (e.g. "go north", "examine desk", "drink potion") and are told what happens ("you cannot go in that direction", "there is a pen on the desk", "you feel reinvigorated"). You have to explore the locations, collect items, use them when appropriate and in general imagine how to overcome the various problems in order to accomplish the final goal of the adventure.

You are Ken Richards, an egyptology student visiting a small Egyptian village where you learn of a legend about a slave who tried in vain to assassinate the Pharaoh and was devoured by crocodiles. His spirit would still haunt the surroundings looking for vengeance against the descendants of the Pharaoh and will be placated only when the medallion worn by the slave will be found and reshaped via melting into an Anubi statuette.
After a nightmare, you awake to discover that you have been left alone in the village while everyone else has gone to look for the medallion as they do each year... and your adventure begins.

104565.name: Neverland Card Battles
104565.description:
User Summary

A PSP game based on the Neverland Trading Card Game. Build a deck with over 200 usable cards. Take control of territory in order to earn points used to play cards.

104566.name: Real Madrid - The Game
104566.description:
User Summary:

In Real Madrid - The Game, you will feel the full experience of being a professional soccer player, not just on the pitch, but off the pitch as well. So grab the opportunity of a lifetime, train hard and give your best to reach the top.

104567.name: The Legend of Heroes III: Song of the Ocean

videogameseries.11187: The Legend of Heroes: Gagharv Trilogy

104567.description:
User Summary

The Legend of Heroes III: Song of the Ocean is an RPG originally released in Japan for Windows, then re-released for PSP in Japan in 2006, and in North America in 2007. This is actually the fifth game in the Legend of Heroes Series, but the series was renumbered for introduction in North America. The story cetners on a young boy, Forte, who decides to follow his grandfather, the troubadour McBain, as he takes a journey to visit every town, village, and city in the land of Weltluna, collecting the legendary Resonance Stones. The game is musically themed, with each party member playing a different musical instrument.

videogame.115147: Double Pack Farm Frenzy 2 and Farm Frenzy - Pizza Party

104568.name: Farm Frenzy: Pizza Party!

videogamecompilation.115147: Double Pack Farm Frenzy 2 and Farm Frenzy - Pizza Party

104568.description:
The goal in a Farm Frenzy game is to raise animals, process the goods they produce and sell the products for cash. Farm Frenzy: Pizza Party! allows players to make pizza by combining ingredients from the farm like cheese and dough with additional ingredients transported in from the city.

Alawar published Farm Frenzy: Pizza Party! in January 2009. It is the third game in the Farm Frenzy series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Farm Frenzy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

104569.name: Taboo Atoll Express
104569.description:
A Forbidden Island themed Express game in the vein of Infection Express, Taboo Atoll Express places the player into the role of the intrepid treasure hunter, on an island that is determined to keep its secrets, and is willing to sink itself in order to protect them.

The player roams around the island, looking for clues as to where the treasure is located, all the while the island is aware and slowly sinking itself to prevent the player from succeeding. Should you spend too much time on the island, you'll sink with it!

Taboo Atoll Express should take around 10-20 minutes to play, has easy setup, and can be played with a handful of colored cubes or markers, and a few custom dice. The game is available for free in print-n-play format from the paperparachute games site.

104570.name: Hidden and Dangerous 2
104570.description:
Hidden and Dangerous 2, like its predecessor, focuses on the British Special Air Service during the Second World War. It follows the same concept as the original tactical first/third person shooter. The game's LS3D engine was used by the game Mafia.

Gameplay elements such as the vocal commands, tactical map control, vehicle usage, equipment selection and the first person mechanic were significantly enhanced from the original. The ability to take POWs, added enhanced stealth options for the player. Mission types very similar to its predecessor include, espionage, sabotage, search and destroy, town liberation, prisoner rescue, retrieval of enemy officers and documents, partisan assistance and assassination. The variety of locales include Norway, Libya, a Norwegian fjord, Burma, Austria, France and Czechoslovakia.

The expansion pack Sabre Squadron adds missions in France, Libya and Sicily. Some of the missions are modeled off of real SAS exploits. However most of the game takes liberty with the historical time and place of SAS operations.[5] The missions are based on sandbox style game-play where players are free to roam a map and pursue objectives usually at their leisure and choice of sequence.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hidden and Dangerous 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

104571.name: UEFA Champions League 2004-2005
104571.description:
User Summary

UEFA Champions League 2004-2005 is am EA Sports title, combining single- and multi-player football gameplay with several other modes, including: UEFA Champions League, Tournament, Situation, Online, The Season, and Practice. Situation Mode is somewhat unique. In this mode, the player can set up virtually any parameters, including which teams are playing, what the score is, and what time remains. Further, game also offers several "challenges" -- both on and off-field missions to tackle, such as having to win a game 2-0, or playing a match without a key player. The player can choose from any of 239 real world football clubs in the game.

The game also features the novel "EA Sports Talk Radio," in which a player can listen to "the fans'" commentary on his performance.

104573.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Immerse yourself in the colorful world of fortune-tellers and snake dancers. Visit a time when traveling circuses of men, women, and beasts were able to enchant entire villages by means of feats, songs, and stories.

In Spectaculum, you determine the paths on which four traveling shows journey through an entire kingdom. On their travels, the entertainers are acknowledged with much applause, but may also get some jeers for poor performances. You determine which shows are worthy of your financial support, but be careful of which entertainers you sponsor - only those with successful shows can help fill your coffers. Whoever turns out to be the most prudent patron by amassing the greatest wealth wins the game.
104573.name: Spectaculum

104575.description:
Steam Torpedo: First Contact is a game of underwater battle tactics for two players, with each game lasting 30 minutes on average.

Before facing his opponent, each player builds his or her own submarine by selecting ten tiles to outfit the different compartments. Shielding, faster engine or firepower: each submarine will thus be unique, and players will need to develop their own strategy!

On the game board, each submarine is represented by a cardboard cutout indicating its position relative to the enemy (front, back or side) and distance (in contact or away). During the battle, players use their five crew members to enable the compartments of their submarine. Various effects can be triggered, in particular to inflict devastating damage to the enemy submarine. A player wins by destroying the control room of the opposing submarine or by eliminating all opposing crew members.
104575.name: Steam Torpedo: First Contact

104576.name: Panopticon
104576.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Panopticon surveys three areas of the Eclipse Phase setting:

Ubiquitous surveillance and sousveillance -- living in a transparent society.





The inner workings of space habitats -- and how to hack them.



Uplifts and smart animals -- their scientific and cultural impacts.


Also includes new morphs, gear, habitat rules, and more!

104577.name: Chazz
104577.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Chazz, you play the role of intrepid cats and show your claws to mark your territory.

Just like in musical chairs, walk around the table and when the leader gives the signal, dash to a seat. Be on the ball because one of the players will be left standing. Keep a close eye on what your opponents are doing and you could the first tomcat to take control of two chairs thanks to your "claw", "spit" and "rub" cards.

A few tactics and a lot of cattiness make this game unforgettable!

104578.name: Verish' Ne Verish
104578.description:
Russian bluffing game using standard deck of cards, similar to Cheat; the main difference is that the called rank stays the same during a round, rather than changing from player to player, forcing people to start bluffing almost immediately.

Play with a full deck for 4+ players, thin the deck to 36 cards (remove 2s through 5s) for fewer players.

The goal of the game is for a player to get rid of all cards they have. Start by removing one random card from the deck (so that there is one rank that cannot form four-of-a-kind) and deal the remaining deck out between the players. On their turn, a player must discard 1-3 cards face down and announce those cards' rank (the same rank being called for the entire round, and players may lie about what they are discarding), or call the bluff of the previous player. When a bluff is called, the played cards are revealed and the loser of the challenge draws the entire discard pile without showing the cards to anyone. After drawing the discard pile, a player may choose to discard sets of four-of-a-kind from their hand (in some versions of the game all must be discarded; in others, only a single set). The player to the left of the challenge loser starts the next round, naming a rank of their choice.

104580.name: Code Lyoko: Quest for Infinity
104580.description:
Game Box

Defeat the X.A.N.A. virus in the action-packed adventure filled with fighting, exploring and teamwork!

Key Features:

- Play and interact with all the Code Lyoko heroes - each with unique skills, powers and upgrades.

- 6 environments to explore including the Digital Sea and the exclusive Volcano territory.

- Lots of cool collectibles and secret areas to discover.

- Fight monsters, new enemies and 5 bosses designed exclusively for the Wii!

104581.description:
In Panic on Wall Street! you take on the role of a freewheeling capitalist out to outmaneuver your competitors and earn your place as a great industrialist.

Players are divided into managers and investors. Your goal is to earn more money than any other manager (if you are a manager) or more money than any other investor (if you are a investor) by the end of the fifth round.

Each round managers and investors negotiate with each other in a noisy, two-minute free-for-all to set a purchase price for shares in the managers' companies. Investors then collect income from the shares they purchased but not until a roll of the dice brings (sometimes drastic) changes to the economy, with major consequences for the balance sheet of each player. Managers collect what they are owed from investors, pay fees for each of their companies, and buy new companies at auction.

After five rounds of play (5 months), the manager and the investor who have accumulated the most money are each declared victors, the undisputed masters of commerce.

Panic on Wall Street! is the new edition of Masters of Commerce. See 'More Information' below for differences between the two editions.
104581.name: Panic on Wall Street!

104582.name: Ancient Game of GOMI
104582.description:
A card game for multiple players with a wizard theme.

From the box art:

A game of strategy and luck where fortunes are won or lost at the turn of a card.

Play for a few minutes or play all night. You control when the game ends. Play against the other players while you play against the dealer. Accumulate the most cash and you're the winner. Easy to learn, tough to master, this action packed, fast paced game has something for all ages.

With six phases, make the most of the cards dealt to you as you choose your "COLOR"; go "HIGH or LOW"; and "COVER" your GOMI cards.

As the deal rotates to you, it is your chance to call for the GOMI to get the other players to "PUT" more than they "TAKE". If they don't there's always "DEALER'S REVENGE".

Any strategy is legal. Play conservatively or risk it all. The right strategy can put you in a position to double or quadruple your cash. Choose your cards wisely because in this ancient game, fortunes are won or lost at the turn of a card.

104583.name: Shin Nippon Pro Wrestling: Toukon Road – Brave Spirits

videogameseries.11486: Shin Nippon Pro Wrestling: Toukon Road

104583.description:
User Summary

Shin Nippon Pro Wrestling: Toukon Road - Brave Spirits is the first game in the Toukon Road series of Nintendo 64 exclusive wrestling video games. The game is licensed by New Japan Pro Wrestling (Shin Nippon Pro Wrestling).

The game features sixteen wrestlers and five modes of play with support for up to two players through the Title Match mode that requires each player to have a Controller Pak (memory card).

104584.name: Air Hoops
104584.description:
This is a dexterity game with a basketball theme. The design is similar to "Space: The Game that Defies Gravity" and features the same battery operated air cushion. Contestants guide the floating basketball across an abstract circular court as they maneuver the ball around two teams of basketball player figures and into hoops.

There are four levels of play based on the number of figures on the court and the number of basketball goals positioned on the outer ring. There is also a timer to increase the level of competition.

Includes the plastic court display, two teams of plastic players, three basketballs, and the rules.

104586.name: Shin Nippon Pro Wrestling: Toukon Road 2 – The Next Generation

videogameseries.11486: Shin Nippon Pro Wrestling: Toukon Road

104586.description:
User Summary

Shin Nippon Pro Wrestling: Toukon Road 2 - The Next Generation is the second, and final, game in the Toukon Road series of New Japan Pro Wrestling licensed, Nintendo 64 exclusive, professional wrestling video games.

This game has twenty-six wrestlers compared to the first game's sixteen. Toukon Road 2 also has a couple of new modes, including an 8 man tournament mode.

104587.description:
We get Freddy Krueger, Freddy Nightmare Worm, Jason Voorhees, Jason Carrying Freddy's Head, and the final uberpiece, Freddy And Jason Together (featuring both figures on a single base). It is worth noting that the scenarios that come with the rulebook do not recommend using this last piece…

The figures are 28mm, and of fine quality, although the factory paint jobs leave a bit to be desired. And for those of you wishing to rebase, they'll come off easily enough (and provide SIX figures rather than five; the Jason Vs. Freddy piece can be separated).

Altogether, a neat tabletop game awaits. Make a neat main event for this coming Halloween, and a nice diversion from the usual zombie geek bingo events…

This is actually a Licensed Starter/Expansion style pack for Horrorclix, and doesn't really work as a stand alone game.
104587.name: HorrorClix: Freddy vs. Jason Collectors Set

104589.name: The Kerberos Club Quick-Start Guide (FATE Edition)
104589.description:
from the publisher website

The Kerberos Club (Fate Edition) is a superheroic roleplaying game in Victorian London using the FATE roleplaying game system. This 28-page Quick-Start Guide gives you a taste of it, with an introduction to the Club, a summary of the timeline, and four sample characters, ready for play, that each highlight different aspects of the setting and its culture: Lady Constance Davies, the Glaifsantes; Sgt. (ret.) William mac Donald, the One-Man Army; Pale Tom Teach, the Gutter Magus; and Jonus Earl Underbridge, Esq., Troll About Town.

140681.name: Castle Panic: Any Color Hero Promo

boardgamehonor.22022: 2013 Origins Awards Best Gaming Accessory Nominee

104590.description:
The Wizard's Tower is an expansion to the board game Castle Panic. It is not a stand-alone game and requires Castle Panic to play. The Wizard's Tower is a cooperative board game for 1 to 6 players ages 12 and up.

Your Castle has been rebuilt, and a friendly Wizard has joined your forces. As long as his Tower stands, you and your friends have access to powerful magic spells.

And you'll need them, for the Monsters have returned stronger, faster, smarter, and with new abilities to threaten the Castle. You'll fight against magical Imps, evasive flying creatures, and more. Make your stand against six new, dangerous Mega Boss Monsters, including the Dragon and Necromancer. Use fire to attack the Monsters, but beware, your Walls and Towers can be burned down as well!

The challenge is high but so is the adventure. Can you survive more panic and defend The Wizard's Tower?
104590.name: Castle Panic: The Wizard's Tower

104591.name: Mega Mall Story
104591.description:
Design a towering mall of mega proportions.The ultimate mall, at the touch of your finger.

Source: The Developer Website.

104593.name: Samba De Amigo Maracas
104593.description:
User Summary:

Released with the title Samba De Amigo, the Dreamcast Maracas are one of the more involved accessories in videogame history. Featuring two plastic maracas with acoustic sensors in their cables (different from the magnetic ones used in the arcade), a base station that has another set of sensors to triangulate where the maracas are, and a foot mat, the entire setup is quite large. Sadly due to the use of ultrasonic sound the controllers are not as accurate as the arcade versions, but that sacrifice had to be made for the controllers to be cost efficient. They are far more accurate than previous game controllers that utilized ultrasonic sound (ie: The Powerglove) and are fairly expensive because of this.

Officially they were only supported by the Samba De Amigo titles, however fans have discovered that they work with Mr. Driller as well.

104594.name: Dreamcast Karaoke
104594.description:
User Summary

Released late in the Dreamcast's life, the Japanese only Karaoke addon attached to the Dreamcast much like how the Gameboy Player does to the Gamecube - it connects through the side serial port (aka where the modem is). It supports external microphones through its two front mounted ¼ TS ports so you can connect any compatible microphone. Sadly because it requires Seganet to obtain new songs, and the servers are long dead, there are only about 10 songs that you can play.

The Dreamcast Karaoke is compatible only with consoles with Japanese Bios.

104595.name: Shin Nippon Pro Wrestling: Toukon Retsuden Advance

videogameseries.11426: Shin Nippon Pro Wrestling: Toukon Retsuden

104595.description:
User Summary

Shin Nippon Pro Wrestling: Toukon Retsuden Advance is the only Toukon Retsuden game on the Game Boy Advance, and the final game in the Toukon Retsuden series of Japanese professional wrestling video games. As the name suggests, the game is licensed by New Japan Pro Wrestling.

The game has 35 wrestlers on the roster, plus 15 hidden wrestlers for the player to unlock.

104596.name: The Video Caper
104596.description:
Front of the book

The Video Caper: YOU are JEM! The Misfits kidnap an English princess -- and blame it on you! You have to find her!

104597.name: The Secret of Rainbow Island
104597.description:
Front of the book

You are Jem! A sneaky businessman wants to destroy beautiful Rainbow Island- and only you can stop him!

104598.name: The Three Investigators in: The Case of the Weeping Coffin
104598.description:
Front of Book

Solve a mystery in a spooky old house. The choices are up to you!

104599.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 9 - Jul 2009)
104599.description:
From the Publisher:

The future never seemed so retro, with this installment of Pyramid, the PDF magazine for roleplayers. This time, the theme is "Space Opera!" In this issue:


Threaten interstellar peace with four cosmos-concerning contraptions in "Doomsday Weapons." These generic devices come with adventure possibilities and can form the basis for a rousing space-opera tale, or even a campaign!
Peek behind the curtain with Rev. Jason "PK" Levine's Designer's Notes for GURPS Psionic Powers. It includes insight into design decisions plus modifiers and options deemed too complex for the mainstream. And the Psionic Powers system is put to good use in the space-opera campaign framework "Agents of PSION," pitting psi-minded Earth heroes against monstrous humans from Mars!
Kelly Pedersen presents five new futuristic styles forGURPS Martial Arts in "Fight the Future."
Visit an odd planet where religion and psionic abilities have combined to form a curious society, in "Terra Incognita: Tangaroa."
Scan unusual items on your interstellar travels with this issue's do-it-yourself prop, the "Space-Opera Scanner."


In addition, Pyramid uses its tractor beams to haul in more goodies that make a magazine fun, including odds and ends, Murphy's Rules with Greg Hyland, reviews and recommendations that fit the theme, and a "Last Word," where we ask an industry luminary to pick a word or phrase related to the issue's theme. This month, Chris Birch -- coauthor and line developer of Cubicle 7's Starblazer Adventures: The Rock and Roll Space Opera Adventure Game -- gives us the last word on space opera . . . the longest Last "Word" yet!

104600.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 10 - Aug 2009)
104600.description:
From the Publisher:

This issue of Pyramid - the PDF magazine for roleplayers - covers "Crime and Grime," and it's criminally full of helpful and fun ideas for a medieval- or fantasy-themed campaign. Whether your adventurers are agents of law and order, actively oppose those agents, or just want to stay out of the way, they're sure to find something they can use. This issue contains:


"The Justiciar," a new template for GURPS Dungeon Fantasy, written by GURPS line editor Sean Punch!
"On De Medici's Secret Service," about a covert organization that keeps the peace in Florence. Written by GURPS Hot Spots: Renaissance Florence author Matt Riggsby, this article comes with a full-color map of the famous city!
"Holy Dirty Money," a description of a widespread type of serious crime commonplace in medieval times that is almost non-existent today.
"Dominion," a full campaign that puts the heroes in the role of the king's agents, responsible for upholding law and order. This setting framework can be used by itself or overlaid onto an existing campaign!
"Cruel and Unusual," a discussion of 18 punishments that can serve as the springboard for adventure.
"Deal the Loot," a card-based method to bridge the gulf between quick-and-dirty robbery or pickpocketing rolls and lengthy roleplaying sessions.


In addition, Pyramid locks up more goodies that make a magazine fun, including odds and ends, Murphy's Rules with Greg Hyland, Steven Marsh's Random Thought Table, reviews and recommendations that fit the theme, and a "Last Word," where we ask an industry notable to pick a word or phrase related to the issue's theme. This month, Simon Washbourne - author of the Medieval Mysteries RPG - gives us the last word on medieval crime and grime.

104601.name: Power Move Pro Wrestling
104601.description:
User Summary
Power Move Pro Wrestling is a professional wrestling game for the PlayStation that uses a roster of fictional wrestlers.

The back of the box states that Power Move Pro Wrestling is "Based on the #1 Wrestling Game in Japan, Toukon Retsuden". Power Move Pro Wrestling keeps the same general game play principles, but drops the New Japan Pro Wrestling licensed wrestlers for fake wrestlers, such as Agent Orange.

104602.name: Thrill Kill
104602.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Thrill Kill is an unreleased game that was finished and ready to ship in 1998, but cancelled when Electronic Arts Pacific acquired the publisher, Virgin Interactive, and decided that the game was too offensive and sadistically violent to ever be released. The game originally received an Adults Only rating (ESRB: AO), but the game was toned down to receive an M rating.

The game was packed with gore and sexual content. After the cancellation of the game, the developers released the disc image to the internet, where it can be downloaded and played using an emulator or by burning it to a disc.

The plot of the game is that ten damned souls are sent to hell and given the chance to fight for reincarnation by the god Marukka. Thrill Kill is a multi-player 3D fighting game with ten playable characters. Each fight takes place in a room where the players all try to build up their kill meter. Kill meter is built up by attacking your opponents. When a character is at full kill meter, they can finish off an opponent with their Thrill Kill.

104603.name: Ask Me Another
104603.description:
The game is a spin-off from a TV show of the same name.
The chequered board has over 100 squares (in pretty lurid colours!) and each square has a letter D on it or a letter E. You throw the dice and move right to left and the square you land on dictates the question you will receive; E = Easy question, D = Difficult question. In the bottom right corner of every square there is a number. If you get your question right, you move forward that number of spaces. If you reach the end of any row on the board, you move down to the next row and continue moving along that row.
The game has a booklet with the rules and 1,000 questions and answers.

104604.name: Wings of Glory
104604.description:
Wings of Glory is a combat flight simulator computer game.

The game uses Origin's custom made RealSpace engine, which was first used in their earlier flight simulator, Strike Commander. The gameplay is primarily in first-person with an option to switch to third-person.

You begin the game as a novice newly arrived in England, and must take part in numerous missions, which involve taking off, completing certain objectives, then returning to base. The various planes that can be piloted are realistic for the time period; there is no radar, and the starting plane is a lowly Sopwith Pup, though they get more advanced as one advances through the game. Each plane has its own machine gun, and some are able to drop bombs.

In addition to the main campaign, there is a Gauntlet mode where the objective is to survive as long as possible against a constant wave of enemies. There is also a level designer, where one can create their own missions.

Source: Wikipedia, "Wings of Glory", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Box Back

They skimmed the clouds and dodged enemy bullets in their canvas-covered "aeros." You join their lofty ranks as an American pilot in the Great War, and learn to appreciate the personalities of both your comrades and the cantankerous planes you learn to fly. You'll develop a passion for real aerial combat--when you've got nothing but your wits and a machine gun keeping you alive.

Pouncing on the enemy from above, or positioning yourself for a kill in a tangled dogfight, you discover the only true goals are staying alive and taking down the colorful machines of the German Hunter Squadrons. As the story unfolds, your skills become legendary--and the adventure intensifies as you match your wits against the best!


Play straight from the CD! You get all the action but use less hard drive space.
Experience how full cinematic speech gives real-world depth to your comrades' personalities.
Claim the hero's role in a gripping story--where the villains are ruthless, the traitors are cunning and the enemy aces reluctantly learn to respect your skill in the air.
Fly and master the Sopwith Pup and Camel, SE5a, SPAD XIII and even a captured Fokker Dr. I.
Take on a sky-full of fighters in Gauntlet Mode, take off on your own with the Mission Generator, and even jump in to see how different maneuvers affect a dogfight with the Flight Recorder.
Encounter a world full of sound with 4-channel digital effects.

104605.name: Uniworld Tri-Lang
104605.description:
An educational game where players take turns drawing and placing cards onto the board. Players score points by completing "books" of three orthogonally adjacent cards of the same type. The player with the most points wins.

The cards feature people from different countries and are written in three different languages (English, French, and Spanish). The game was developed in concert with UNICEF.

Also contains instructions for an advanced variant for adults.

Contents:

54 character cards
1 plastic gameboard

104606.name: Big League
104606.description:
An English soccer game. You get 25 players, enough for two teams plus two substitutes.Every player has a moveable leg that, when let go, can kick the ball for a shot on goal or a pass to a team-mate.
The board is a large green baize cloth and you get plastic goals.
And enamel paints are enclosed in each game so that you can paint your team in your favourite team's colours.
On its release, the game used Martin Chivers (a famous England centre-forward at the time) to promote the game.

videogame.78621: The Settlers: Heritage of Kings – Gold Edition

104607.name: The Settlers: Heritage of Kings – Expansion Disc

videogamecompilation.78621: The Settlers: Heritage of Kings – Gold Edition

104607.description:
User Summary:

This expansion disk introduces an all-fresh campaign: Nine new missions of exploration and discovery of a mysterious and unknown land. You can play three new exclusive heroes and decide the fate of this new land on new original single and multiplayer maps.

104608.name: Jagged Alliance: Back in Action
104608.description:
User Summary

Jagged Alliance: Back in Action is the official sequel of Jagged Alliance 2 and the first in the series that does not feature turn based combat.

It will feature the so called "Plan & Go" system in which the game can be paused anytime and a set of complicated orders be given to each soldier. This is supposed to allow for complicated tactics which get executed by each soldier at the same time.

This new system gets a lot of bad reactions from the solid fan base and the lack of Fog of War is also not well liked.

104609.name: Twin Galaxies: Version Légère
104609.description:
Présentation Rapide
Twin Galaxies est un jeu de rôle de Science-Fiction, totalement gratuit, appartenant principalement au genre du Space Opera, dans lequel les héros vivent des aventures épiques à l’échelle des galaxies jumelles. On y trouve également une touche de Hard Science de manière à définir des technologies plausibles et ainsi permettre de vivre des aventures d’une grande variété au sein d’un environnement riche et détaillé.

Google Translation
Fast Introduction
Twin Galaxies is a role-playing sci-fi game that is totally free and mainly belonging to the genre of Space Opera, where the heroes live epic adventures across the wide galaxy. There is also a touch of Hard Science so as to define plausible technologies and allow the adventures of a wide variety within a rich and detailed universe.

104610.name: Mathematrix
104610.description:
Theme: Mathematrix is a fun and fast mathematical thinking game, which use creative spatial logic for drafting and laying tiles on common table in effort to outsmart other players.

Object of the game:
The object of the game is to be the first to reach 50 points on the score track.

Mechanics:
