There is precious little time for you and the Doctor, and perhaps everyone else. It will be a true test of your ingenuity to avoid becoming galactic statistics as you Find Your Fate.

User Summary:

Unlike other gamebooks in the Find Your Fate series, the Doctor Who series uses dice, and visual puzzles in addition to the reader making the decisions in the book.

104920.name: Links: Championship Course: Troon North
104920.description:
User summary:

This add-on course was compatible with:

- Links: The Challenge of Golf
- Links 386 Pro
- Microsoft Golf

The course, just north of Scottsdale Arizona, opened for play in March 1990 and quickly became the #1 golf course in Arizona.

104921.name: Links: Championship Course: Banff Springs
104921.description:
User summary:

This add-on course was compatible with:

- Links: The Challenge of Golf
- Links 386 Pro
- Microsoft Golf

The Banff Springs Golf Club is located in Alberta, Canada.

104922.name: Invasion of the Ormazoids
104922.description:
Publisher Blurb

YOU are the Doctor's only assistant as you face an entire race of mutant warlike beings in INVASION OF THE ORMAZOIDS.

It is the twenty-fifth century. The Doctor has set your coordinates for the rim worlds - a turbulent, primitive, and strange region. There, at the edge of the universe, you are fated to meet Darval, an evil ruler with a fascinating history and bizarre energy.

But of more immediate danger: Darval's Ormazoids, a race of beings originally created to assist him in space exploration but now bred by Darval to be fearless and unstoppable - and to carry out his commands for domination of the universe.

YOU and the Doctor must seize control of Darval's Master Genetic Code Signifier - the device that controls the Ormazoids. Otherwise, Earth and her empire will fall prey to his ruthless plans. Outnumbered and outmuscled, YOU must rely on your intellect as you FIND YOUR FATE.

User Summary:

Unlike other gamebooks in the Find Your Fate series, the Doctor Who series uses dice, and visual puzzles in addition to the reader making the decisions in the book.

104923.name: Links: Championship Course: Bay Hill Club & Lodge
104923.description:
User summary:

This add-on course was originally designed for Links: The Challenge of Golf, but could later be added to Links 386 Pro
& Microsoft Golf.

Designed by Arnold Palmer, Bay Hill Club and Lodge annually brings together some of the finest golfers in the world for the Nestlé International.

104924.name: Race Against Time
104924.description:
Publisher Blurb

YOU and the Doctor must join forces to find and destroy the most awesome device ever created in a RACE AGAINST TIME.

Doctor Who is the world's greatest Time Lord, but an awful calamity has befallen him. Along with YOU and his companion Peri, the Doctor is caught in Time Limbo - the worst possible place for a Time Lord to be!

Your goal is to help the Doctor reach and defuse the Time Destabilizer, an invention that threatens not just the Solar System, not just the Galaxy, but the entire Universe! If you fail, you will be suspended for all eternity in a vacuum with no light, no dark, no beginning, no end.

This is the biggest challenge you've ever faced. The decisions you make will shape the destiny of all life in the galaxy, so do your best to FIND YOUR FATE.

User Summary:

Unlike other gamebooks in the Find Your Fate series, the Doctor Who series uses dice, and visual puzzles in addition to the reader making the decisions in the book.

104925.name: Links: Championship Course: Barton Creek
104925.description:
User summary:

This add-on course was originally designed for Links: The Challenge of Golf, but could later be added to Links 386 Pro
& Microsoft Golf.

Designed by Tom Fazio, this course is one of the four championship courses located at the Barton Creek Country Club in Austin, Texas.

104926.name: Links: Championship Course: Bountiful Golf Course
104926.description:
User summary:

This add-on course was originally designed for Links: The Challenge of Golf, but could later be added to Links 386 Pro
& Microsoft Golf.

Designed by William H. Neff Golf Course Architects, this course is nested in the shadows of the picturesque Wasatch mountains.

104927.name: Links: Championship Course: Hyatt Dorado Beach Resort
104927.description:
User summary:

This add-on course was originally designed for Links: The Challenge of Golf, but could later be added to Links 386 Pro
& Microsoft Golf.

Designed by Robert Trent Jones, the Hyatt Dorado Beach East Course is one of the world's greatest seaside links.

104928.name: Links: Championship Course: Firestone Country Club
104928.description:
User summary:

This add-on course was originally designed for Links: The Challenge of Golf, but could later be added to Links 386 Pro
& Microsoft Golf.

Designed by millionaire industrialist Harvey Firestone in 1928, and redesigned by Robert Trent Jones in 1959, Firestone's South Course has become one of the premier stops on the PGA tour.

104929.name: In The Money
104929.description:
From the box: Learn coin recognition and money skills while counting and exchanging money as you shop around the path and move to the finish line.

Gameplay summary: There are two game boards in the box (one double sided board).
Game 1-Shopping Spree-On each turn, players roll two money dice and one number cube. Players get the total amount of money rolled (in coins only) and move forward the number of spaces on the number cube, and follow the directions on the board. Some spaces allow players the opportunity to buy at item. First player to buy items worth $2 or more wins. An alternate rule set uses bills only and players create $1 item piles. When all items are purchased, the player with the highest total wins.

Game 2-Search & $ave-Roll and move around a board, getting or giving back coins based on where you land on the board. When the first player gets to finish, all players add up their money, and the player with the most money wins.

104930.name: Wake Up Calls
104930.description:
User Summary

You play as a mouse, or hamster, falling on a leaf. You pass branches with varying numbers of chrysalis on them. For each jump you make, you can shoot up to three times, if you hit a chrysalis, it opens and a butterfly is released. This is how you score points. Aiming is done with the mouse.

104931.name: Microsoft Golf
104931.description:
User summary:

Microsoft's first golf simulation, already built on Access' Links engine, and fully compatible with its courses.

The game, which brings Windows 3.x support for the popular Links series, is a detailed simulation, allowing the player to enjoy the official PGA Torrey Pines Golf Course.

Includes many features one would expect of a true sports simulation, like practice ranges, aerial course previews (with terrain analysis) and hot-seat multiplayer.

104932.name: Heartlight
104932.description:
User summary:

Basically a PC clone of Boulder Dash, but with better graphics (than the CGA version) and sold as shareware. It added some small hazards, like bombs, grenades and plasma.

104933.name: Risk
104933.description:
User summary:

The Computer Edition of Risk is an official conversion of the classic Parker Brothers board game. Two to six human and/or computer players attempt to conquer the world with their armies. All the rules of the board game are here, including trading in Risk cards and rolling dice. Computer players have three different skill levels, which you can change during the game. You can even change players between computer and human in the middle of the game.

104934.name: Twin Galaxies: Concept
104934.description:
Introduction
Tout un Programme!
Vivez des aventures horsnormes à travers des myriades de mondes au milieu des luttes
incessantes que se livrent les quatre Clans qui ambitionnent de dominer leurs rivaux.
Parcourez des mégalopoles surpeuplées, traversez des paysages de toute beauté, retrouvez des vestiges sacrés, inspectez des stations orbitales abandonnées…
Découvrez les galaxies jumelles, les milliards de systèmes qui les composent, les sept espèces intelligentes qui les peuplent et les différentes factions qui essayent d’élargir leurs sphères d’influence par tous les moyens…
TG Concept, tout l’esprit de TG en seulement 40 pages.

Google Translation
What a program!
Experience adventures through myriads of worlds in the midst of unending struggles. Engage the four Clans who aim to dominate their rivals.
Browse overcrowded megacities, cross the beautiful landscapes, sacred relics find, inspect the abandoned space stations ...
Discover the twin galaxies, the billions of systems that make up the seven intelligent species that inhabit them and the various factions trying to expand their spheres of influence by any means ...
GT Concept, the whole spirit of TG in just 40 pages.

104935.name: Liste d'Équipement
104935.description:
User Summary
This is a list of equipment available to characters in Twin Galaxies.

Includes statistics for:

Armes & Explosifs Marques
Armes & Explosifs Génériques
Armures & Protections Marques
Armures & Protections Génériques
Vêtements & Bagages
Matériel Médical
Outillage & Kits
Informatique & Électronique Marques
Informatique & Électronique Génériques
Robotique & Cybernétique Marques
Énergie
Bivouac de Survie
Véhicules & Vaisseaux
Divers

104936.name: Feuille de Combat
104936.description:
User Summary
This is a page for organizing and carrying out multiple-character combat in Twin Galaxies. It can be printed out and used many times for a single adventure, if necessary.

104937.name: Fiche de Supervision
104937.description:
User Summary
This is a page for organizing party statistics (players or NPCs). Character class, traits, strengths and weaknesses can be recorded conveniently on this printable page.

104938.name: Twin Galaxies: Codex du Maître
104938.description:
User Summary
The manual for Twin Galaxies, including game rules, character creation, tables, history, and everything necessary for setting up and running campaigns using the Twin Galaxies world.

104939.name: Slim & Fast
104939.description:
Introduction
Tout, Tout de Suite!
Vous êtes pressé?
Vous n’avez pas le temps, ni l’envie d’ingurgiter des pages et des pages de système et de contexte? Vous voulez lancer vos premières parties sans tarder? Vous avez déjà de la bouteille et vous n’avez pas besoin de vous encombrer de tout un tas de conseils et de recommandations? Vous préférez vous contentez d’un système simple et
efficace? Vous allez adapter vos propres idées, votre cadre de jeu maison ou un univers issu de fictions que vous et vos joueurs appréciez?
Normalement, vous êtes au bon endroit.

Mince, c’est Rapide!
Avec Slim&Fast, les manuels de base de Twin Galaxies ont subi une sévère cure d’amaigrissement! Profitez en!
Vous ne trouverez ici que l’essentiel, les fondamentaux de l’univers des galaxies jumelles et du système de jeu. De quoi créer, incarner et camper des personnages
rapidement au sein d’environnements déjà bien détaillés mais aussi facilement malléables.

Google Translation
All at once!
In a hurry?
You do not have the time nor the desire to swallow pages and pages of system and context? Want to start your first few games without delay? You already have the bottle and you do not need the hassle of a lot of advice and recommendations? You prefer to be content with a simple and
effective? You will adapt your ideas, your frame of play from home or a world of fiction that you and your players enjoy?
Normally, you're in the right place.

Damn, it's fast!
With Slim Fast, the basic textbooks of Twin Galaxies suffered severe weight loss! Enjoy!
You will not find here that the essential fundamentals of the universe of galaxies and the twin system of play What create, embody and camping characters
rapidly in environments well detailed but easily malleable.

104940.name: Slim & Fast: Fiche de Personnage
104940.description:
User Summary
This is a character sheet for use with the Slim & Fast version of Twin Galaxies.

104941.name: Annexe I: Foire aux Questions
104941.description:
User Summary
5 pages of FAQ for the Twin Galaxies system and world.

104942.name: Annexe II: Glossaire General
104942.description:
Introduction
Ce glossaire a pour vocation de lister la plupart des termes spécifiques à Twin Galaxies: les noms communs et les noms propres utilisés par le système de jeu et l’univers.

Google Translation
This glossary aims to list the most specific terms in Twin Galaxies: common nouns and proper names used by the game system and the universe.

104943.name: Annexe III: Liste des Abreviations
104943.description:
User Summary
This is a list of all the abbreviations used in the documents for Twin Galaxies.

104944.name: Annexe IV: Parlez-Vous TwinGa?
104944.description:
Introduction
Twin Galaxies utilise une nomenclature proche de celle du langage universel pour désigner un certain nombre de technologies, de systèmes ou d’infrastructures spécifiques à l’univers des galaxies jumelles. Cette nomenclature utilise ainsi des combinaisons de mots de différents types, en général deux : un préfixe et un suffixe.

Google Translation
Twin Galaxies uses a classification similar to that of universal language to describe a number of technologies, systems and infrastructure specific to the universe of galaxies binoculars. This nomenclature uses and combinations of words of different types, usually two: a prefix and suffix.

104945.name: Annexe V: La Science-Fiction
104945.description:
Introduction
Un Genre Multiple
Intéressons nous de plus près à ce qu’est la science-fiction (SF). Il s’agit d’un genre déjà assez ancien, à l’origine exclusivement littéraire, puisqu’il date de Jules Verne et de H. G. Wells. Depuis, sous l’impulsion de nombreux auteurs, cinéastes et dessinateurs, la SF a bien évolué et s’est vue adaptée à de nombreux médias. État des lieux.

Google Translation
We focus more closely to the nature of science fiction (SF). This is a genre already quite old, originally exclusively literary, since the date of Jules Verne and H. G. Wells. Since, under the impulse of many authors, filmmakers and artists, science fiction has evolved and adapted to many media.

104946.name: Annexe VI: Statistiques
104946.description:
Introduction
Voici quelques statistiques intéressantes concernant les dés à 6 faces et les probabilités des résultats que l’on peut obtenir lors d’un jet de dés. Il est possible d’évaluer séparément l’influence de la Mantisse et l’influence de l’Additif. et s’est vue adaptée à de nombreux médias. État des lieux.

Google Translation
Here are some interesting statistics about the 6-sided dice and the probability that the results can be obtained in a roll. It is possible to separately evaluate the influence of the mantissa and the influence of the additive.

104947.name: Cannon Strike
104947.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

«Cannon Strike» is a unique mix of arcade and strategy genres, allowing to jump from the role of a squad commander to a commander's seat in an advanced battle tank.

After choosing the campaign - whether to play for USSR or for the allies, (Great Britain and France) - the player is given a number of various missions. During some missions the player will be in charge of a group of military forces, while in the others he will take the pilot's seat in a battle tank ('tank arcades'). The game represents a number of tanks that a player can run, including Soviet 'T-26', 'T-34' and 'IS-2', British 'Valentines' and 'Churchill' and even French 'Somua S-35'. Our bonus system allows the player to get extra weapons, ammunition and fuel. For succeeding in completing missions, the player will be advanced in rank.

KEY GAME FEATURES:
· Unique mix of arcade and strategy
· Realistic physics, totally destroyable environment
· Detailed landscapes
· Advanced bonus system: liquid fire guns, machine guns, armor piercer, repair
· Simple and easy-to-deal-with controls
· Special features available: artillery support, air scouts, air strikes, regular reinforcements
· Every unit under the player's command gains experience and increases his abilities
· Great variety of military vehicles and an extension selection of tanks to take under player's control.

104948.name: La Torre de Rudesindus
104948.description:
From the back of the book:

"¡Bienvenido a la torre del gran mago Rudesindus!

Ahora que has firmado el contrato de servidumbre deberás cooperar con los demás demonios al servicio del gran mago para realizar las tareas que vuestro señor os encomiende, tales como interrogar al prisionero, remendar la alfombra mágica o regar las plantas… carnívoras.

Recorre todas las estancias de la torre y conoce a sus extraños habitantes: la princesa cautiva, el espejo zalamero o el esqueleto errante. ¡Hay mucho trabajo por hacer, no te quedes ahí mirando!

Si eres lo bastante bueno y utilizas hábilmente tu dominio mágico, tal vez algún día llegues a jefe de lutines y controles la poderosa Campana de Llamada.

Y recuerda: nunca, nunca entres en la habitación prohibida.

La Torre de Rudesindus en un juego de interpretación para dos o más jugadores que te convierte en un diminuto demonio servidor de un gran mago y recrea la divertida situación de realizar las tareas diarias, que pueden resultar colosales para seres tan pequeños, antes de que el señor de la torre regrese.

En este libreto encontrarás todo lo necesario para jugar: reglas rápidas y divertidas, una exhaustiva descripción de la torre y sus habitantes y una completa lista de tareas a realizar, cada una de las cuales es el germen de una insólita aventura.

Necesitarás tres dados de seis caras y una campanilla para jugar a este juego."

In english (google translated):

"Welcome to the great wizard Rudesindus' tower!

Now that you have signed your servitude contract, you must cooperate with the other demons in the service of the great wizard to perform the tasks assigned to you by your master, such as interrogating the prisoner, mend the magic carpet or watering plants (which are carnivore, by the way).

Go through all the rooms in the tower and get to know its strange inhabitants: the captive princess, the flattering mirror or the wandering skeleton. There is much work to do, so don't just stand there looking!

If you are good enough and you use your domain skillfully magic might one day get to the head of the powerful and controls lutin Bell Call.

And remember: never, ever go inside the forbidden room.

The Tower of Rudesindus is a role-playing game for two or more players in which you play a great wizard's tiny daemon servant, and recreates the funny situations of daily tasks, which can be huge for such small things, before the lord of the tower comes back.

In this booklet you will find everything you need to play: fun and fast rules, a comprehensive description of the tower and its inhabitants and a complete list of tasks, each of which is the point of origin of an unusual adventure.

You'll need three six-sided dice and a bell to play this game."

104949.name: Cannon Strike 2: The Great War
104949.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

"Cannon Strike 2: The Great War" combines elements of a tactical strategy and arcade gameplay. During some missions the player will be in charge of a group of military forces, while in the others he will take the commander's seat in a battle tank! The game reveals the story of a tank - one of the world's most terrifying weapons - during the WWI. The player is off to take part in WWI's most famed battles by leading Russian, British, French or German troops.
Cannon Strike 2 The Great War presents wonderful visual effects, dynamic gameplay and a great variety of tasks.

GAME FEATURES
- realistic physics, totally destroyable environment
- detailed landscapes
- advanced AI
- advanced bonus system
- simple and easy-to-deal-with control system
- units development
- wide range of vehicles available
- great variety of tanks for direct controlling
- Allies: the player is none of a stand-alone heroes, his allies assist him in completing the task
- Special features available: artillery support, air scouts, air strikes, regular reinforcements
- Playable nations: Russian Empire, Great Britain, France, Germany
- Direct control vehicles: Einhardt, A7V, Mark V, Austin armored car, Renault FT17

videogame.125700: Dracula: The Path Of The Dragon – Part 1

104950.name: Dracula 3: The Path of the Dragon

videogamecompilation.125700: Dracula: The Path Of The Dragon – Part 1

104950.description:
Dracula 3: The Path of the Dragon is a horror adventure video game based on the characters from Bram Stoker's Dracula. It follows 1999's Dracula: Resurrection and 2000's Dracula 2: The Last Sanctuary. As of April 2010, Dracula 4 is in development. Dracula 3 is a first-person, adventure puzzle game. It breaks off from the traditional point-and–click adventures by introducing a movement system, instead of still-screen to still-screen. The player may interact with characters, objects, even animals.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dracula 3: The Path of the Dragon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

104951.name: Find'em
104951.description: A popular party game. Guests are given a picture with mistakes in it and then they are invited to spot the errors during the evening. The one who finds the most, wins. THere were at least two in the series and this version is known as The Street Scene.

104952.name: Haunted Village
104952.description:
Common folk think you are a madman – but that's because they fear what they cannot comprehend.

You’ll have to gather all your strength to beat the demon that inhabits the church. Be the first to defeat him otherwise it will be too late.
 
This is the game for 2-4 players. Start your adventure and place 3x3 Outside location cards face down. Each player takes a book that was given to them. Place Inside locations, Adventure deck and Bosses near the board.  Players start their turn by taking 1 card from Adventure deck then they must beat the ghost on location, play Adventure card and move. There are different types of cards (see rules). The main point of the game is to beat Boss with enough points in your collection.
 
Compete with others by playing Action cards and Ghosts on them. But be careful not to give advantage to them.

This is an adaptation of the print and play game Fatal Frame

104953.name: Ghost of Mondstille
104953.description:
From the introduction:
This is a short adventure designed to take place around Mondstille, in the Grey Mountains above the Reikland. But with a little work, it can be moved to any time and place. All it requires is an isolated dwelling and a reason for PCs to stop by for the night.

104954.name: Picture Bingo
104954.description: 36 cards, each featuring colour pictures of assorted items. The deck is divided in two, with one deck used by the 'Caller' and the other deck by the players, who must match their hand of cards with the other cards as they are displayed. A simple children's game.

boardgamehonor.24510: 2013 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee

104955.description:
Antike Duellum – previewed at Spiel 2011 under the name Casus Belli – is a two-player strategy game based on modified rules from Mac Gerdts' Antike. The game includes two scenarios: Punic Wars (Rome vs. Carthago) on one side of the board, and Persian Wars (Greeks vs. Persians) on the other. The goal of the game is to be the first to gain nine ancient personages (Kings, Scholars, Generals, Citizens, Navigators).

Examples of modified rules from Antike:


Modular layout - when a player founds a city, he chooses whether it produces Iron, Marble, or Gold
Over 20 event cards, which provide more variety in the game
Town walls for individual protection of cities
Each "Know-How" costs a different amount - for example, inventing the market is more expensive than inventing the wheel
A new Know-How for trading goods with the bank
Higher costs for legions and galleys - they are first recruited from the bank to the personal supply (paying gold)
Easier rules for conquering cities with no movement of units
104955.name: Antike Duellum

104956.name: The Conspiracy of Unkind Constables
104956.description:
From the Introduction:

The Conspiracy of Unkind Constables is a role-playing game, where players take on the role of Ravens tasked with watching over the journey of souls from this world to the next. This is a game about telling stories, weaving together the actions of all the players. It is suitable for group play of any number of persons, with one taking on the task of Story Teller.

In order to play, this game uses a six-sided die to determine the results of any challenge. Each player will need at least three dice, whereas the Story Teller will need one die per player. Paper and pencil are optional, as there is little to no elements that need to be tracked. The following sections will detail the dice mechanics, character creation, and guidelines for telling stories.

104957.name: Battle of Kulikovo 1380
104957.description:
Simple wargame about crucial battle in Russian history. This battle was a turning point in the process of the Russian liberation from the Golden Horde. The game has 4 scenarios. One big historical battle and three other small scenarios which will help to introduce the game to new gamers. In the big battle the Russian player has to defend his positions against Mongol attacks and then provide counterstrike with his reinforcements. Furthermore, there is a meeting engagement in 3 other scenarios.

Game scale.
1 hex is 100 m.
1 turn is 15-20 min.
The counters represent 150-250 men.

104958.name: HelperMonkey.Com
104958.description:
From the Introduction:

They say a man with a lot of responsibility, a man who can perform a number of jobs wears many hats. Here at Helper Monkey, we've taken that sentiment to heart. If you have a problem, any problem, we'll dispatch a team of cybernetic monkeys to help you! Our team of monkeys come with bio-mechanical neural interfaces to give them the skills they need to complete any mission. This not only allows our monkeys to understand both written and spoken language, it also allows them to learn valuable skills based on the hats they equip themselves with. To have Helper Monkeys solve your problem, simply log on, describe the nature of your problem in 140 characters or less (we do accept tweets), and our code monkeys will trace you down and send a top team of gorillas, chimpanzees, orangutans, and other simians to help you! No matter the problem, no matter how far, we have a monkey in a hat for that!

About the Game:

HelperMonkey.com is a silly game of action, adventure, and bananas. Each player takes on the role of a primate cybernetically enhanced to possess certain skills based on the specially prepared hats they wear. You'll choose your animal and adjust his abilities. Then, you'll choose his primary hat, which you are presumed to always have. You'll then choose one Perk and one Drawback. One player will not play one primate, but will instead represent the rest of the world. In different games, he has different titles, such as Game Master or Storyteller. In this game, he's the dispatcher, the one responsible for deciding what mission your monkeys will be sent on. He will also monitor the mission to keep you (and the code monkeys back at home base) aware of everything going on. If there's ever a question about what happens, the dispatch will monitor the situation impartially and make the call.

To play this game, you will need some pencils, paper, a few players, some fudge dice (ideally four per player, but we'll talk about how to get around that later), some tokens to represent bananas, and some imagination.

104959.name: Scavengers
104959.description:
From the Introduction:

In Scavengers, you will assume the role of a Soul unbound by Time and able to bring its current incarnation with where it goes. You will discover the connections between you, your ancestors, and other Scavengers. Maybe you will stand shoulder to shoulder with kin and cadre, somewhere in the farflung future or distant past, and stare down Death one final time.


Out of a barn near a creek, she stumbled into daylight and squinted her way to a farmhouse where the surprised housewife tried to chase her out with a knife. Both women, resembling each-other so closely as to appear siblings, died that afternoon. The ones who see behind the veil, the beings outside-of-time, again paused in shock: the two souls, linked by generations, fused into an even more powerful point of energy. The Soul which had already thwarted Death once blazed with the intensity of the original Spark as it threaded along its timeline to a new location; the ancestor completely engulfed within, it had become the first of the Scavengers.


What you will need


2-5 players, counting an optional GM.
Writing sticks and a surface - markers on a whiteboard on the table, filing cards, looseleaf, napkins, the paper from a Write Your Own Will Kit would be rather clever.
A deck of cards - Using a standard 52 card deck will be explained, but I trust that a Tarot deck like the Rider-Waite (with its numbered major arcana) would work really well with just a bit of tweaking.
A few dozen counters - pennies, glass beads, knuckle bones, even that bucket of dice you have sitting around and won't be needing today.

rpg.11526: P'tor-Ra: Return of the Lizard Gods

104960.name: P'tor-Ra: Return of the Lizard Gods
104960.description:
From the Saurians Introduction:

The scientists got it wrong. Not all the dinosaurs are extinct. In the late Jurassic Era, a species of raptor discovered the ability to communicate with each other through thoughts. Over the centuries, this evolved into a shared-mind consciousness which enabled the raptor brains to exceed the limits placed on the size of their brains. A civilization developed, based on a store of knowledge and the easy to hunt emerging mammals. Tools were developed, the megafauna tended, and species bred to enhance their individual natures. Key to their success was the Ytenn species discovering the ability to control lesser minds. No longer were the raptors hunted by T. Rex or other dinosaurs. Brontosauri were kept like cattle, used for their brute strength or raised for their meat.

The P'tor-ra dominated the landscape for a brief time, however. Just as they began to develop true societies and kingdoms that may have left fossil records, they discovered a massive comet about to smash into the planet. The P'tor-ra put all their efforts into finding away to escape the impending doom. Using controlled dinosaurs and burrowing mammals, massive caverns were tunneled deep underground for the P'tor-ra to hide in. each tunnel was covered with an immense capstone, then marked with a giant pyramid of stone -- perhaps the only structure that would survive the cataclysm and mark their resting place should other saurians seek them out after the cataclysm.


From the Humans Introduction:

The announcement of new chambers found beneath the burial chamber in the Pyramid of Khafre in Giza was met with much excitement. Early reports spoke of an early form of hieroglyphics as yet unknown to archaeologists and pictographs of an early Egyptian creation myth. Within a few days, however, the Egyptian Supreme Council of Antiquities announced the closing of the site to all but one team of renowned archaeologists. No further information about the chambers were released.

Inside the team discovered two rooms. The most interesting one was a circular chamber, uncommon in Egyptian construction, with the unusual hieroglyphs covering every surface and a massive stone circular slab set in the center of the room. The room was undoubtedly older than the Pyramid itself, but lack of material prevented any radio-isotope dating. The outer room seemed to be of later design, contemporary with the pyramids. It appeared to detail the discovery of the circular chamber and a translation of the strange writing within it. Those who have studied it have described the carvings as the "Myth of the P'tor-ra", that came before mankind.

104961.name: of Knights Glory
104961.description:
From the Introduction:

This document encompasses a story telling game, whereby you the players will work together, and at times against each other to tell a noble story of Knights battling against evil in the land.

This game will present you with a starting point, and each player will add to the story as it becomes their turn, Each player will be telling the part of one of King Arthur's knights, the goal being the defeat of the evil monster of the deep, or some other evil. Although the knights will work together to defeat the beast, they also want to stand out amongst their piers and gain the most glory and honour.

104962.name: Showdown at the Desert Fortress of Professor Anteater

rpg.11528: Showdown at the Desert Fortress of Professor Anteater

104962.description:
From the Introduction:

Showdown at the Desert Fortress of Professor Anteater is a roleplaying game designed for 3 to 5 players. Showdown is a storytelling game in the vein of Fiasco or the Shab-Al-Hiri Roach. It differs from traditional roleplaying games in that there is no gamesmaster, instead the players are working together to create a great story. However Showdown also has a competitive element. The game is presented as a one-shot story, but players can replay as much as they want.

In Showdown each player creates a superhero who wishes to get a place in the Defenders of the Galaxy, the greatest superhero team on planet Earth. The heroes have been sent to defeat Professor Anteater before he can fire his Doom Laser. The heroes will have to work together to make it through the Professor's desert fortress, but at the same time they will be trying to show themselves to be the most impressive as only one of them will make it into the Defenders.

104963.name: Black Box Game Book
104963.description: Eric Solomon wrote this book, to set 80 problems for keen Black Box players. The problems were sorted by a computer (very high-tech for its era).

104964.name: Inch²
104964.description:
From the Author:

Square Inch - or Inch² - revolves around the world of journalism, shady information sources, dodgy dealing, and conspiracy. Each player assumes the role of mouthpiece for a website known for revealing the 'absolute truth' behind the news.

From the Introduction:

Each player in a game of Inch² interacts to create a storyline, a world view that allows them to drive toward a conclusion that wins them the plaudits and puts their opponents in doubt, out of the spotlight or, even worse, in litigation or bankruptcy. Every player maintains their own distinct 'character' developing a story that matches their world vision and their combination of resources. Collectively, the group spins the news into an interconnected storyline, but in the end only one can triumph.

Inch² best suits one-off pick-up gaming intended to fill a moment between games or sessions, when not everyone can attend for the weekly game or a breather just seems like the right thing. The average game of Inch² should likely take no more than an hour or so from start to finish.

While role-playing games often include a moderator, or Gamemaster, who pushes the game forward and defines success through a set of rules, Inch² doesn't have anyone in this position. The job of progressing the game and ruling on conflicts falls to everyone participating in the game - the players police their own challenges and conflicts. At the start of the game, the participants create their characters, define the organizations they work for, and set a starting point. Then, using the rules, contained herein, and a process of action and counter-action, rumour and rebuttal, the game progresses towards a conclusion.

Inch² should be played as a game of storytelling conflicts, with a fair and practical approach advancing toward a conclusion. Players should use their imagination to weave threads of association between the start and close of their conspiracy and, effectively, role-play the figurehead of the organisation they create. Without storytelling, the game could easily become a string of bets and dice rolls, which certainly is not the intent by any measure.

104965.name: Líder (15 Aniversario - Especial Módulos)
104965.description:
Spanish Líder Magazine Special 15th Aniversary

Summary:

"James Bond 007 - Operación Rompehielos
Fanhunter - Por fin ya es viernes
Paranoia - El Anillo Comunista
Vampiro: la Mascarada - Hermanos de Sangre
SuperHéroes Inc. - Misión Lunar
Vampiro: Edad Oscura - El Veterano de Hattin
El Señor de los Anillos - Tharnefuin
Deadlands - Camino de Abilene
La Llamada de Cthulhu - La bestia no debe nacer
In Nomine Satanis - El Predicador
Magna Veritas - La vida es como una caja de bombones
Dungeons & Dragons - El Ducado de Sparkguard
Aquelarre - El despertar de la Bestia
Stormbringer - El Último sueño de Erael
RuneQuest - Asuntos de familia
Nephilim - El nombre de la Rosa
Traveller - Asunto de Comercio
Star Wars - El camino del Jedi"

104966.name: Monkey Bomb Squad
104966.description:
From the Introduction:

In the modern world, terrorism has escalated and now our most precious resource is the bomb disposal technician. Terrorists have begun targeting the techs themselves until a shortage occurred. Mechanical assist devices are good, but they can't get everywhere.

What the world needed was someone willing to be the eyes and ears of a bomb tech. Someone who could go where mechanical devices couldn't go and then get the job done. Of course, very few people would volunteer for a job like that.

Enter the US Government with a solution. They had been working on breeding more intelligent capuchin monkeys which they now set to training as they eyes and ears of bomb disposal technicians.

The Monkey Bomb Squad (technically known as Capuchin Anti‐Terrrorist Coordinating Handlers or CATCH) has been in limited operation for two years. It is top secret both to keep terrorists from adjusting their tactics and to prevent public outcry over the use of monkeys in this manner.

104967.name: Year of Meteors
104967.description:
From the Introduction:

Year of Meteors is a three player GM-less roleplaying game set in reconstruction era America. It is assumed that the reader is not only au fait with but also keen on all of those things. The game requires four white poker chips (representing moral fibre), five red poker chips (representing wicked tendencies) and a coffee mug.

104968.name: Safari Photo Africa: Wild Earth

videogamehonor.32169: 2003 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Winner

104968.description:
User Summary:

In this stunning educational adventure game you are a photojournalist in Africa and your assignment is to photograph various wild animals. The game features breathtaking landscapes from the African Serengeti National Park, where you can experience the African wildlife in its natural environment. Your assignments encompass different photographic objectives, challenging you to explore and take the appropriate photographs of animals and environmental features.

Beyond the scope of the game, the photographs taken can also be saved on your computer as html files for independent use.

104969.name: Feudal Clans
104969.description:
Each player controls a clan in the Highlands or Lowlands of Scotland. The game recreates a period of Scottish history when famous clans struggled for control of Scotland.
Features in the game include - mountain passes, boats on lochs, alliances, hand to hand fighting, capturing men, ambushes, scaling castle walls and a changing weather aspect.
The designer printed prototype copies and advertised them for sale, with instructions how to paste up the board.

104970.name: Mushika
104970.description:
Author's Description:

Ganesha is a beloved Hindu god. His image is unforgettable: an elephant-headed, pot-bellied, multi-armed, one-tusked, benign-looking figure, often carrying an axe, a goad, and his broken tusk.

In this roleplaying game, the players are rats who take turns acting as Mushika - Ganesha's vahana (animal companion and mount). These are no ordinary rats! Strong as a bull for carrying things, clever as a fox or even two, agile as a monkey (well... in their own minds), and plucky as a rooster on caffeine, these rats are Mushikas! Four different types, even!

But one evening, Ganesha's hat is stolen and only the Mushikas can save the day for Ganesha!

This complete game is a "one-shot" adventure for a GM and up to four players.

104971.name: Drop in the Bucket
104971.description:
This is a dexterity game using marbles and a looped track.Players drop these marbles in a series of metal buckets. Each bucket has a different score value. The marbles are launched with a spring-loaded device similar to a pinball machine.

This is a tin game crafted as one solid unit.

104972.name: The Patriot Incident
104972.description:
From the publisher:

A murdered arms dealer and a handful clues...

It is a night of celebration in Boston, but a group of extremists have other plans...

This heart-pounding investigation pits your players against an unexpected threat. They have less than 12 hours to track their leads and stop the attackers, or Boston will never be the same.

The Patriot Incident is a Terror Network module, and provides the gamemaster with a complete counter-terrorism investigation. It includes 19 suspects and over 20 locations for your players to investigate as they race to stop a major terrorist attack.

104973.name: Solar Station Alps
104973.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome to Solar Station Alps.

It's another day of sitting around, waiting for the daily jobs to arrive. About the only interesting thing on this backwater station is poker. Of course, there's nothing worth betting out here, so the person who wins gets to pick the job. Whether it's worth the effort or not is a gamble in and of itself, but out here you have to make your own fun. The upper crust sure isn't going to do it for you.

In this game, the universe is filled with Anthromorphs, or human/animal hybrids. Whereas most games featuring furries give you many choices to entertain, this game gives you one. You are a goat. While this is not really the most glamorous of Anthromorphs, they are usually the hardest working in the galaxy. And Solar Station Alps is where your company sends out the herds.

The game will pretty much start the same way. During the daily poker game (one of the few luxuries afforded to the herds), jobs will be posted. Whoever wins the last hand of poker gets to choose the job the herd will undertake. Complete the job and the company profits. Miss out on a deadline, well... even the station needs window washers.

104974.name: Satyr Play
104974.description:
From the Introduction:

Satyr Play is an RPG for three persons. It is set a long time ago in the days of ancient Greece. More specifically it is set around a great acropolis (think of it as a castle) where the resident princess is about to be involved in a love triangle with a satyr and a hero. Near the acropolis is a large forest where the satyr lives.

104975.name: Russo-Japanese War 1904-1905
104975.description:
Small size Strategic level wargame for Russo-Japanese War. The game cover from the battle of Yalu River to the battle of Mukden. This game only use 40 counters and 16 cards on the 420x297 mm map sheet. Japanese title "Nichiro Taisen" means Great war between Japan and Russia.

Players control military units and resource of either Japan or Russia. The resource represent by strategic card to use trigger various events, take reinforcement units, make forced march or additional combat. Card engine similar to No Retreat!.

The game objective is to reduce the national morale to zero.

104976.name: Grandma's Game of Riddles
104976.description:
McLoughlin had had high sales with their Grandmama series of game and Milton Bradley decided that it should grab a share.

Players have to answer the riddles correctly to score points. Naturally, the game was seen as educational, a prime attribute in the years just before the 20th century began.

104977.name: Frog, Pipe, and Prison
104977.description:
From the Character Creation section:

You are a member of the Frog Clan.

The clan has a duty to keep the Celestials imprisoned lest they make good on their ancient promise to destroy the Earth.

You, personally, have a duty to imprison a specific Celestial. This duty has been handed down from Frog to Frog over the eons. When one Frog dies there is always another prepared to be the Celestial's jailor.

You have given up a piece of yourself in order to hold your Celestial in place. But it works both ways; you get to use a bit of that Celestial, too.

104978.name: Quadraughts
104978.description:
The classic game of draughts for 4 people. Same objective as draughts: to eliminate all your opponents pieces, and same rules as draughts / checkers -- jump over opposing pieces to capture. But Quadraughts requires a lot more skill and strategic nous.

Unique 13 by 13 square grid board with 4 sets of different coloured draught pieces.

For 4 players or 2 teams, for all the family, aged 6+

Players: 4 (or 2 playing 2 colors each)
Board: 13 x 13 squares alternating black and white. Some squares have coloured spots.
Pieces: 12 each player (in 4 distinct colors)
Placement: The pieces (men) are placed on the squares on the first three rows in front of each player, on the appropriately colored spots.
Moves: Men move diagonally across the board on the black squares, one square at a time, in a forward direction. Kings (see below) may move forwards or backwards.
Commencement: The players decide who should begin and players take it in turns to move, in a clockwise direction.
Capture: A piece is captured by jumping over it and removing it from the board. Several pieces may be captured in a single move by making successive jumps with a single piece. The men captured do not all have to be of the same color. If a capture is possible, it must be made. Failure to do so results in “huffing”, the removal of the offending piece by the opposing player.
Crowning: A man which reaches the farthest row of the board, ON A SPOTTED SQUARE is crowned as a king by placing a second man on top of it. It can then move both forwards and backwards. If the man lands on a square (on the farthest row) that is not spotted it returns to any spotted square of the first row of the board to begin again. If all the spotted squares on the first row are full than the man moves to the nearest spotted square to the first row.
End: The game ends when three players either lose all their men or can no longer move.

104979.name: Socceristic
104979.description:
Socceristic is a very realistic representation of an actual game of football (soccer). Players choose either a club or national team they wish to be and play out a challenge match following the rules laid down for the world's number one sport.The board game creates excitement, brilliant moves, joy and disappointment, great banter and re-invents imagination.

Socceristic is the only football (soccer) board game that features every rule in football, including scoring goals, tackles, fouls, injuries, substitutions, sending-offs, penalties etc. The objecticve is to score more goals than your opponent in the pre-agreed time.

The board is a scaled down pitch divided into squares. Movement of the ball is determined by throwing the dice, the icon in the square the ball lands in, the square in which the ball finishes determines the next action, either via a direction arrow or one of 27 Outcome cards or 27 Referee's Decision cards.
There are injuries to deal with and there are yellow and red cards to contend with.

For 2 players or teams, aged 8+

104980.name: Aggression: Reign over Europe
104980.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

This game pushes the limits of real time strategy, thanks to a graphic engine supporting hundreds of detailed units in action at the same time. A full 3D scenario where every building is constructed in detail based on hundreds of polygons, with stunning graphics and special effects. Choose your side - Germany, France, Russia or England - and become the most powerful force on the continent, cleverly using diplomacy as well as your powerful army. The chance to rewrite history has never been so challenging!

Main Features of the Game:
- Historical strategy game in a time period of 1910-1950.
- Completely 3D graphics in tactical and strategic mode, detailed map of Europe.
- Total freedom of player's choices in strategy of own nation, capability to make an alternative history of Europe.
- Four playable nations: Russia, Great Britain, Germany, France.
- Historical campaigns for each key nation, during which the player may fulfill several hundred quests and experience the entire age of Total Wars, participate in both World Wars.
- 3D strategic map of Europe, with dozens of active historical figures.
- More than 150 types of combat units (infantry, cavalry, artillery, tanks and armored vehicles, aviation), modeled accurately from historical references.
- Political, economic and combat systems, which realistically convey the peculiarities of European politics and wars in 20th century.
- More than 200 real historical figures: politicians, generals, public figures who lived and made a difference in this time period.
- Large scale battles on 92 tactical maps, all in 3D.
- Battles at sea, land and air, battle planning, development of new arms and technologies, (from a machine gun to the atomic bomb), political alliances and espionage.
- State of the art level of graphics, realistic physics, a wide choice of special effects, which create a unique, cinematic gameplay experience.

104981.name: Colors of Grey
104981.description:
From the Introduction:

Throughout the ages, there have existed secret societies that have dedicated themselves to the fine art of thievery. These organizations, commonly known as "thieves guilds," have existed to unite an underground of criminals whose life's work involves the pilfering of other peoples' life's works.

In Colors of Grey, you will be a member of one such secret society, known as the Chameleons - so called for their ability to adapt to any situation. Chameleons consider themselves connoisseurs of fine art and specialize in the theft of rare statues, paintings, drawings, and other such works.

The Chameleon guild has existed for centuries without being uncovered in any serious way by any sort of law enforcement agency. Though individual Chameleons may occasionally be captured and interrogated, their secrets continue to remain uncovered - possibly because they blend into their surroundings and hide in plain sight, making them difficult to uncover as an organization.

Being invited to become a Chameleon is an honor extended only to those thieves who are exemplary and exhibit mastery of their craft; amateurs are too easily spotted and captured, making them a risk to the organization. As expert Chameleons, players should try to act accordingly.

104982.name: Department 13
104982.description:
From the publisher:

Welcome to the sourcebook for Department 13, Avalon Game’s science fiction/horror game. This sourcebook is based on the Infinite Futures game engine, which is Pathfinder compatible, but the source material can be used for any campaigns based in an alternative history where the Nazi regime has succeeded in global domination through arcane magics. Department 13 is set in the late 1950s to early 1960s, but can be readily altered for nearly any era.

104983.name: The Entente WWI Battlefields
104983.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

On June 28, 1914 in the center of Saraevo Gavrilo Princip shot Archduke Franz Ferdinand and his wife. Those shots began one of the bloodiest wars in the history of mankind - the First World War. For four long years the earth trembled from gun explosions, the air was whistling with bullets and the sky was covered with smoke and ashes. It was the first war with such amount of troops to take part in it, and with military operations going on earth, in the skies and seas, even under the water. Weapons of mass destruction were used for the first time... Now you have a chance to see it with your own eyes and try to change the history in "The Entente game". The Entente is a real time strategy. Choosing one of five available countries, (France, Germany, Russia, Austro-Hungary, England), you get troops under your command with various units starting from infantry and cavalry and ending with battle ships. All units were made true from historical point of view by using archive documents and photos. Every nation has its own features, which allow you to use strengths and weaknesses of troops from different states.

Various resources present economic aspects in the game: Wood, iron, gold, electricity, oil and food, different facilities that are historically true, branchy upgrade system. Economic and military advisors are present in the game to facilitate control over economic and military development. Advisors assist in upgrades, obtaining resources and producing units. You can take part in almost all major and important battles of the First World War fighting for this or another side. Thus you will get a chance to learn more about historical battles and battle outcomes as well as change the history. There are more than 1000 structures on the map and 80000 units, highly detailed landscapes, 3D sound and full encyclopedia of armament - all these gives you a chance to go deep into history and feel like high military commander entrusted with the fate of the nations.

Game features:
- Historically true soldiers and armament created on the basis of real archive documents;
- Up to 80 000 units on the map;
- Units can hide almost in any structure and defend it;
- Well-known and little known historic battles;
- Branchy upgrade system;
- Economic and military advisors that can be set up;
- Highly detailed 3D landscapes;
- Different types of units (from infantry to ships);
- Network game via LAN and the Internet for up to 8 players.

104984.name: TearRing Saga
104984.description:
User Summary

A Tactical RPG with many similarities to the Fire Emblem series; both games were developed by Shouzou Kaga. The game features two main characters who split up and divide your army, you are able to choose what army characters join and are able to swap them and items at points in the story where the armies meet.

104985.name: The Nose Game
104985.description:
A game you had to collect, the cards being in with your packets of cigarettes.
It is a set collecting game but with the novel feature that you are collecting noses. The amusing cards feature five kinds of nose - Artistic, Impulsive, Enquiring, Aggressive and Commercial.
There are 10 examples of each type of nose and you presumably had to collect as many types of the same nose as you could.
As often happens with cigarette card games, the cards remain within the family but the rules (which you wrote off for, all those years ago) are lost.
The advertising leaflet proclaimed "Laugh while you play - learn character-reading at the same time".

104986.name: Pacific Storm
104986.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

An exciting hybrid title, Pacific Storm mixes the strategic elements of RTS titles with the action of an arcade title. RTS fans will enjoy classic strategy elements including resource management, unit and building construction and unit deployment, while action fans will be happy to take to the skies or seas as they directly control units in intense combat.

Your fleet in Pacific Storm includes battleships, aircraft carriers, destroyers, cruisers, missile cruisers, submarines and torpedo boats as well as tankers and transports. The aerial war is conducted using fighters, (at first piston-powered and in later stages jet fighters), attack aircraft, torpedo bombers and strategic bombers. There are different types of units, all carefully modeled from WWII-era aircraft and ships, in the game. Also, you can develop new technologies and create new weapons systems, which may almost instantly overturn the global balance of power. About 100 technological improvements, (upgrades), enhancing combat effectiveness of warships and military aircraft are available. In addition to the strategic mode with its 127 different Pacific zones and 40 naval bases, you can play 20 historical battles, including the Battle of Midway, the attack on the Japanese admiral Yamamoto's plane, and the battle for Guadalcanal.

Pacific Storm is all about battleships and aircraft carriers "the giants of naval warfare during WWII", about captains and admirals, as well as rank-and-file soldiers and sailors of the two great military powers locked in a life-and-death conflict. In Pacific Storm you can become the Commander-in-Chief responsible for the lives of thousands of servicemen and the destiny of his country; or the commanding officer of a small squadron; or even an ordinary military pilot fighting in the sky over the Pacific. Gradually, as you play, from all these separate bits and pieces will emerge one impressive picture of the great and fierce battles fought in the Pacific during WWII.

104987.name: Dragon Knight 4
104987.description:
User Summary

A turn based Tactical RPG, control a party of up to eight characters in battles to defeat the sorcerer Lushifon.

The DOS version of the game featured erotic scenes, which were removed from the later SNES, PS, and Saturn releases.

104989.name: The Greyhound Racing Game
104989.description:
You needed good lungs in 1927! The 52 cards which had to be collected, are as follows;

15 Whips
16 Obstacles
10 Greyhounds in singles
10 Greyhounds in groups
1 Hare

Each turn players must play a card face-up in front of them. This continues until someone plays the Hare card. then the Chase starts and the first player to play a single greyhound card, wins.

Very nice artwork on the cards.

104990.name: TearRing Saga: Berwick Saga

videogamefranchise.6399: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)

104990.description:
User Summary

TearRing Saga Series: Berwick Saga is a Tactical RPG and a sequel to TearRing Saga. Unlike the original TearRing Saga this game changes enough about itself to lose it's obvious resemblance to Fire Emblem, making it a very different game than the first. Characters now move on hexes and you are able to pay people around town to join you in battles, possible gaining them as permanent characters.

104991.name: Salammbo: Battle for Carthage
104991.description:
Publisher's description

In a battle of Power and Deception.

The proud city of Carthage has been overthrown by Rome, its arch rival. In the midst of war, Salammbo, the daughter of commander and the Carthaginian forces, must deliver a message to Matho, the leader of the mercenaries, the main force laying siege to the once glorious city. Putting her life in your hands, she asks for your help.

Take on the role of Spendius, a favored slave and Matho’s close companion. Discover the epic story, first as a fugitive, then a spy, a soothsayer and finally a General, and forge your destiny in a world filled with treason and exceptional heros.
Main features

- A dramatic and epic adventure, with many unique and intriguing characters to interact with.
- Adventure, action and strategy gameplay elements.
- A series of beautiful original artworks frescoes integrated into the storyline and interface.
- Immersive, ambient and emotional soundtrack, including Dvorak’s ‘New World of Symphony’
- Based on the famous Flaubert novel and Philippe Druillet’s cult comic strip.

104992.name: Curse of Atlantis: Thorgal's Quest
104992.description:
Publisher's description:

Step through a portal between worlds, and discover the path that will lead you to your final destiny.

Take on the role of Thorgal, a mighty Viking warrior and decendent of Atlantis who uncovers a magical artifact which allows him to see his own future.

Caught between reality and a prophetic vision, Thorgal discovers a foretold future of a horrific incident that will end the life of his beloved son. In a desperate attempt to alter the destiny of his child, Thorgal sets off on an incredible adventure where mystery, danger and magic will unfold.

Main features:

- A perfect blend of adventure and action with unequaled 3D graphics and fluid animation.
- Engaging and challenging quests to complete.
- Interact with numerous intriguing characters.

104993.name: Universal Monsters: Monsterville
104993.description:
User summary:

Labeled as a "management game" by its publisher, Monster Ville could better be described as an action/basic RTS game with a humorous tone, starring the Universal Studios Monsters: Dracula, the Monster of Frankenstein, the Bride of Frankenstein, the Werewolf, etc.

The objective is to control a medieval town of humble peasants by hypnotizing the citizens. Two or more monsters compete for the domination of the town and have a limited time to use their magic powers to convince a majority of peasants to rally to their cause.

Each monster has its own special powers (e.g. Dracula can fly), strengths and weaknesses. You can use a series of traps to stop your enemy's advance (e.g. place a mirror somewhere to stop Quasimodo, since he can't stand his own reflection), or build new dwellings for your supporters. On certain maps, there's a "neutral" monster that you can hypnotize too and use as a secondary character to gain support amongst the citizens twice as fast.

104994.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In City Tycoon players assume the role of businessmen investing their own capital in expansion of the city. Their main purpose is to increase the standard of living, and thus the happiness of its citizens. They have within reach a whole range of projects that the city council wants to achieve, but which lack the funds. By skillfully selecting plans, using available space and deciding which projects their money should be spent on they will be expanding the city and competing for the title of the most people-friendly company.

During play, the game board is expanded by players laying down tiles, with each tile representing a piece of the city, a district that might need to be provided with electricity or water in exchange for receiving some benefit. Some of the tiles require a supply of luxury goods; others generate them; others give only points of happiness, such as the hospital.

Resources are common, and each of them can be bought by players from power stations and waterworks. These resources, however, are not unlimited and their use must be well planned. Keep in mind, too, that you must pay opponents when transporting raw materials through districts they own.

Game play in City Tycoon passes through four stages, and in each of them the buildings get larger and more impressive while at the same time requiring more resources and giving better benefits. Players quickly notice the relations between them and may choose several possible strategies to develop their investments, for example, focusing on making money, constructing scoring buildings to the exclusion of all else. Each of these strategies has its pluses and minuses, and the actions of other players might force you to expand in new directions and change your tactic.
104994.name: City Tycoon

104995.name: Scotland Yard
104995.description:
User summary:

Scotland Yard is a faithful computer version of the popular board game of the same name, developed by Cryo in collaboration with Ravensburger (publisher of the board game): Mr. X, a fixture on England's "Most Wanted" list, is on the run in London. Will Scotland Yard find and capture him before time runs out?

The main map shows 199 stations in the city that can be reached by taxi, bus or underground. Each type of transportation costs a ticket. One player takes the part of Mr. X and slinks around the city, leaving clues for the others, who are the Scotland Yard detective team. If Mr. X manages to escape capture, he/she wins. All the detectives see is which travel ticket Mr. X used during that turn. The detectives must plan movement routes to surround Mr. X and try to cut off his lines of escape. To make things difficult for the detectives, they only have a limited number of tickets, and when they run out of a ticket type, they cannot use that mode of transport anymore.

As a ‘bonus’, you can choose to play the "computer enhanced" version, which purports to add RPG elements such as money, weapons, fighting, health and conversation. The players can visit the stations and interact with people or locations. Detectives have to catch criminals in order to earn money so they can buy information about Mr. X. Mr. X has to find specific items in order to win. He can rob people or houses to earn money. Weapons, tickets and other helpful things can be bought at different locations. A lot of people offer information for a price. Only a gang boss of a district can sell Mr. X pricey information about the quest item. But to find the gang boss you need to buy information about his whereabouts first.

Overall, Scotland Yard is a game that emphasises logical deductions and strategic planning over luck. You can play either as Mr. X or detective, solo against the computer or with friends.

104996.name: The Edge of Midnight GM's Screen
104996.description:
From publisher blurb:

This handsome GM’s screen gives the Game Master everything he needs to run an exciting Edge of Midnight game right at his fingertips. Contains six inserts containing pertinent charts and rules, along with gorgeous full-color artwork from the inestimable Nate Barnes. A must for any fan of The Edge of Midnight!

104997.name: Stealth Combat: Ultimate War
104997.description:
User summary:

This game takes place in the near future (2038), where the world is divided by a war between 2 entities: the Economic & Military Alliance (EMA) and the Great Empire.

The game uses a first-person perspective to place the player at the center of the action. The player must choose his faction, and then undertake 25 missions, usually at the command of a vehicle (tank, helicopter, jeep, amphibious, etc).

104998.name: The Chabuli Conspiracy
104998.description:
From Introduction:

The Chabuli Conspiracy is an investigative adventure for use with Thousand Suns. Although complete in itself, owing to the nature of the events described, many sections of the adventure are non-linear and open-ended, allowing the Game Master the flexibility to tailor the adventure to suit the nature of his campaign setting. The GM is thus encouraged to make whatever changes he feels are necessary to make this adventure fit the "reality" of his own setting.

104999.name: Nightmare of Druaga: Fushigino Dungeon
104999.description:
User Summary

Control a man named Gil in his journey to save his fiancee Ki from an evil sorceress. Buy and equip items and accept side quests in towns then enter dungeons to explore and defeat enemies and bosses.

105000.name: Tsugunai: Atonement
105000.description:
User Summary

Reise is a mercenary who takes on dangerous and difficult jobs to pay off a large debt. During the retrieval of a sacred artifact he angers the gods who separate his body and soul. The only way Reise can regain his body is to demonstrate kindness and courage by possessing people in a small fishing village in order to help them preform good and courageous deeds that they would otherwise be incapable of doing themselves.
